Or even be suppressed?The story tend to let us get the deny answer of this. Self-treatment is better and so Mc Murphy introduced all of the patients to the fish boat owner as Dr. A, Dr. B..when they were escape for their vacation. Besides that scene, another points for supporting mutual healing or self-healing could also been found by Mc Murphy speech to the chief (ask him try to play basketball. Of course, it was a surprise that the chief had no mental disability when the movie was going on) Such encouragement had 2 purposes: 1st point was to show the magic held by another mad man, who could heal the self-closing chief, as all of the doctors in the house have already given up to do so; 2nd thing was more important, it was the clue to guide the ending of the story.The story completed in the way that changing impossible to possible. Mc Murphy was the leader to emphasize the spirit of trying. He knew the washing tray was heavy enough for him, but still tried to move it. Also, he usually persuaded the patient to escape; it actually means the continuous spirit for fight to the destiny, the power and the guys who discriminate them. No one can tight them, as ling as they were willing to turn them down. The chief had done it and escaped away. Is his freedom good for him? Not really, he may fail to adapt the environment and got dead. But who know else? At least he got a new live rather than a ridiculous survive in the routine jail house, even it is more dynamic.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is one of those movies that you watch, and a couple of years later, you watch it again, and continue to watch this movie throughout your life, when you are in the mood, and feeling it is time to watch it again. This movie is a masterpiece of a movie. If you have not seen this movie, I highly recommend that you watch this movie.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Ken Kesey's blistering attack on American society as viewed through an insane asylum where R.P. McMurphy (a career-best Jack Nicholson) is sent for "evaluation treatment".Oscars went to Nicholson, Louise Fletcher as castrating Nurse Ratched, producer Michael Douglas and Milos Forman's unblinking direction. One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest spent 14 years in development limbo but remains the most radical film to emerge from mainstream Hollywood. Too many classic set pieces to mention but keep your ears cocked for that immortal line "Mmmm, Juicy Fruit." The best film of that era... Certified brilliance!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: We have always seen Jack Nicholson as somewhat of a Lunatic in his movies, slightly evil, slightly murderous, but never have we seen a bad performance.One Flew over the Cuckoo's Nest is one of the Movies that best suits to Jack's Style, not to mention his face, one look at his grin and you want to run to mama. Playing a convict who is not necessarily crazy, but does seem to be a challenge, but he pulls it off with such perfection that I dare you to find a flaw. The accompanying cast provides an interesting and colorful backdrop to his crazy shenanigans, but be on the lookout for the performance of Oscar Winner Louise Fletcher as Nurse Ratched, she is one evil nurse, she inhabits her role with such a powerful presence, that if she were really a nurse, most patients would pretend health just to be free. They really are memorable performances, capped off with Milos Forman's Best Work in my opinion, you really have a Grade A Movie.A Word of Advice, if you have some petty grudge against any of the actors involved, leave it at the front Desk, and come inside the Ward, you will be pleasantly surprised
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Who is good and who is bad? Well first I have to say that the direction of this movie is excellent, and has no equal, it is what I consider a Stanley Kubrick movie, from its views and ideas. Well lets get to it, Mac Murphy is a rapist, a man who doesn't like rules, and doesn't like the authorities faces, and will do anything to be a fascist towards them. Yet he is claiming he is crazy and runs away from the society of corruption that he built, by manipulation. And gets stuck with a middle age nazi like women, whom, if you have read the book, has control over any one and will beat any one if she wants to. There is the idea of who is the good guy and whom is the bad, who is crazy, and whom is not, who is the real fascist, well I'll tell it to you, Mac Murphy and ratchet, they both represent the hate and the corruption in the world today, it's existence and life. When Mac Murphy tried to pick that sink he was unable, he couldn't reach freedom, and enlightenment, but the death and dumb Indian did, if you read the book, the world was spoken from his eyes, he manipulated everyone, he is the bad guy, so is everyone, the whore, the dead kid, the black boys, mc Murphy and ratchet, teachings of anti everything.  And yet there is levels again like fascism, Mac Murphy turned out to be a vegetable, by the strict orders of ratchet, him going against societies illnesses, and then crushed, I disagree with the minority that believe this movie is crap, cause craziness, is a representation of corruption, and it was not Billy whom was corrupt, it was miss ratchet and every son of a bitch who walks on the streets, it isn't the crazy people whom are crazy but the sane people whom are.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is quite simply an outstanding movie, that deserved the 5 Academy Awards it won. Jack Nicholson is as fantastic as ever, and the supporting cast, most notably Christopher Lloyd, make this movie one of the greatest and one of the most unique ever made.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie is a fantastic film based on a very realistic book.I just want to comment on some of the other messages on this board to say that this movie DOES NOT REPRESENT the Nixon era and the Vietnam war.  The book was written in 1962 which was when Kennedy was President.  The movie was made in 1975, only due to problems with copyright approval.The film is a fascinating character study and a definite MUST see. Louise Fletcher and Jack Nicholson deliver Oscar winning performances.  And the movie also won best picture.  Fletcher's Nurse Rachet is one of the most hated villains in movie history.  In fact, her Academy Award winning speech began with the words, "Thank you for hating me So much."  And as the director Milos Foreman once said, "Jack Nicholson was sent from heaven.  He doesn't just play R.P. MacMurphy.  He Is R.P. MacMurphy." The DVD version is fantastic and has great info on the cast and movie development.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: An ultimately powerful, tragic, and terrific movie.
Review_body: I will not hesitate in saying that "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" is one of the most powerful and emotionally provoking movies in existence. It is something that truly cannot be ignored. While I will am sure that I have not even come close to seeing all of the great movies in existence, as of right now "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" is indeed one of the most entertaining, moving, and brilliant movies that I have ever seen.In the beginning of this movie we are given an outside view of the mental hospital that will serve as the main setting of the movie. After the introductory credits we are give a look inside the hospital, and we are then introduced to a whole new community, the patients in the ward. Soon after we are given an introduction to the character that will truly start off the entire movie, Randall Patrick McMurphy.Jack Nicholsons performance as McMurphy is without a doubt not only one of Nicholsons greatest performances, but one of the greatest performances of all time. McMurphy is a fairly sane criminal in the movie who is jailed for charges of assault and statutory rape. Pleading insanity, McMurphy hopes to serve out his jail sentence with comfort inside of a mental ward. What Nicholson brings to McMurphy is the ultimate anti-authority character, with a sly pranksters sense and someone who will try to change the environment around him, probably by causing trouble. What is McMurphy trying to change and rebel against? It all lies within the mental hospital.Inside the mental hospital resides a slew of mental patients, headed by the ever-controlling Nurse Ratched. Here lies even more great performances, particularly the one of Nurse Ratched, who is played by Louise Fletcher. She is a woman who enjoys being in control, mainly because she believes that what she does is what is best for her patients. Mentioning the patients, they are among the most memorable characters in cinema history. Whether it be the stuttering Billy Bibbit(portrayed by Brad Dourif) or the seemingly intelligent Harding (played by William Redfield), each of the patients that the movie focuses on are wonderfully crafted by the actors who portray them.Among these patients McMurphy tries to stir a rebellion against the dominating Nurse Ratched, though that is where I will stop in my description of the movie. I will say, though, that this movie shows just how important acting is in the movie, and this movie features some of the best."One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" is one of the most compelling, shocking, and perhaps tragic movies that I have ever seen, and, to top it off, one of the greatest.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Possibly the best drama, if not the best movie, of all time.  AFI has it rated as #20 two above 2001, which is silly seeing as how 2001 is in my opinion only liked because Kubrick made it, in reality its slow, long, and boring.  But back to One Flew, it is an amazing piece of film with some of the best acting I have ever seen, Jack Nicholson's character is the typical antihero everyone loves, just when you think he has learned his lesson....well I won't ruin it. DeVito, Christopher Llyod, Cheif, and the others in the hospital brought the movie together. This isnt the most exciting movie, but it is amazing nonetheless.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I had to live in a state institution for the physically disabled in the 1980s and this film was a favorite of my fellow 'patients' and 'staff'.Although our 'infirmities' were physical not psychiatric, we related to One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest. The monotonous routine of institutional living, the ways we tried to break routine, the strives against boredom, the political minefields, staff power trips, getting in or out, or getting visitors- we related to this film.Whichever the institution type (i.e. mental, penal, physical, rehab) this movie portrays the dynamics of folks involved in the institutional environments of it's era to a perfect reflexion.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: The ultimate legend of all movies. The movie that changed everything. Jack Nicholson appears after his first big role in "Chinatown" and shines. Milos Forman`s creation has to be praised- a mixture of drama and comedy fulfilled with deep emotions. Forman presents a whole new world, a world behind "the Wall". There is one enthusiastic person who tries to destroy, or better, avoid this barrier, but finally fails. Like the political scene in the middle 70`s in Europe, two different worlds separated, causing so much pain and trouble for a ordinary person. Inside "the Wall" the regime dictates and jepardizes the basic thoughts of democracy and freedom. Formans great talent to find a balanced story, which enters deeply inside of you; and a remarkable cast of Nicholson, Fletcher, DeVito and Redfield all together make a winning formula.This film is the real prototype of all the modern movies made after it, from the "Rain Man", the "Deer Hunter" to the modern "Girl. Interrupted".Forman and Kubrick led us into a new era of film, as the real leaders of modern Cinema.This is the one of ten or tweenty movies you MUST SEE. 10 of 10
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Sanity is a matter of perception.
Review_body: One of the universal characteristics about works of fiction is the audiences ability to relate to the characters. It is the common traits that we share with them that brings them to life. We can easily identify with a characters triumphs, their intentions, their failures and their frustrations. Many of these traits are easy to identify. They are either black or white, good or bad. One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest goes into more of a gray area, giving us one of the all time great unanswered questions- What is crazy? When the film begins we are introduced to the hospital, set in 1963. The ward is run by Nurse Ratched (Lousie Fletcher), a woman with a sweet yet stern and cold face. When we are introduced to the patients we as the audience automatically assume we are crazy. Some of the patients outright exhibit deranged behavior. Others seem eccentric and a few seem downright "normal" but we assume they are there for a reason.We are then introduced to the films main character, RP McMurphy (Jack Nicholson). Despite his claims that he is crazy, it is made clear to the audience that McMurphy is not crazy but attempting to avoid jail time for criminal behavior. Nicholson's portrayal of McMurphy is nothing short of masterful with his over the top explosiveness and outbursts to his subtle reactions of his observation of the hospital.McMurphy's persona at once makes him a hero to the inmates and an enemy to Nurse Ratched. Almost instantly a war has begun between McMurphy and Nurse Ratched and neither side will back down. Fletcher's portrayal of Nurse Ratched is the personification of order. The sweetness that she portrays is phony and unsettling. The coldness and cruelness laying just below her surface becomes more and more apparent as we can see that she will go to any length to have control and show no mercy.We also get to know the characters better it is revealed that many of them are not insane at all but rather socially inept and loners. The revelation to McMurphy that these inmates are there voluntarily is almost an unbearable shock. These men are not there because they are evil or dangerous. They are there because they can not function within our society.McMurphy leaves his impression on all of the inmates, but the one he reaches through the most to is a gigantic mute Native American character simply referred to as the Chief. The Chief silently observes all activity in the ward while showing no emotion. It is his interaction with McMurphy that brings him to life and brings him to start speaking again.The heart of this film is not about mental illness. Despite taking place in a mental ward and there being mentally ill characters in the background, this is a film about human spirit. Spirit is what McMurphy has in abundance, what the inmates in his circle are critically lacking and what Nurse Ratched and the institution labels as insanity.And yet the war inevitably comes to its conclusion. SPOILER ALERT- Nurse Ratched's determination to have control and complete lack of mercy takes its toll on one of the most innocent inmates and drives him to take his life. The tragedy of his death unleashes the pent up rage that has built up in McMurphy and he unleashes it on full force on Nurse Ratched.The end result is a tragedy. The hospital lobotomizes McMurphy. He is now a vegetable and will be for the rest of his life. The Chief is horrified when he discovers his beloved friends fate and immediately smothers him with a pillow, doing him the favor of a quick death instead of spending the rest of his life immobile.Earlier in the film McMurphy had tried to lift a heavy marble water fountain out of the ground. When he failed he was mocked and he replied to the rest of them that at least he tried. Upon Mcmurphy's death the Chief does what had been laughed at as impossible- he rips the water fountain out of the ground and throws it through the window. The closing shot is of the Chief running away from the hospital....free from the hospital and free in his soul. He no longer needs the hospital. He was won the war that McMurphy started.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: A man is sent to a mental asylum in Oregon and challenges a nurse for the souls of the inmates.
Review_body: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is one of the best films of the 1970s. It is based on Ken Kesey's novel of the same title. The title comes from the children's nursery rhyme that goes, "One flew east. One flew west. One flew over the cuckoo's nest. It later became a hit stage play starring Oscar nominee Kirk Douglas. Kirk's son, Michael, later bought the film rights and felt that his father was too old to play the part of Randall Patrick McMurphy. James Caan turned down the lead role. Jack Nicholson also turned it down and then changed his mind. The film became a box office hit and won five Academy Awards. Jack Nicholson, Louise Fletcher, Bo Goldman, Milos Forman, and Michael Douglas were awarded Oscars for their excellent work. Brad Dourif was nominated for best supporting actor, but lost to George Burns.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I cannot remember how many times i have watched this brilliant film!! Fantastic acting by each and every actor participating!!!!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" is an outstanding film. Not only is the directing of Milos Forman among the best achievements in film history, nearly all of the actors are at their best and helped in making this movie an excellent display of dedication to the role. I must admit that I didn't recognize Danny DeVito because he played so differently than in most of his later films which were mainly comedies, and although I wouldn't say those later films were not good either, his best role in my opinion was the one of Martini in this film. About the talent and dedication of Jack Nicholson a lot of people have said enough and I can only repeat what has been said before. But again, in this movie he kind of outperformed himself compared to most of his other films. Louise Fletcher has played another brilliant part, making an excellent opponent for the tragic hero played by Nicholson. And finally, Will Sampson, who died much too early, has given this film an important twist, without which it simply couldn't have been complete. But every supporting actor played absolutely perfect either, there is no weak acting or other flaw in this movie. I have not given many movies a ten, but this one deserves it - among few.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the greatest movies of all time!!
Review_body: This movie has a very good storyline. The way the characters are represented is incredible. Acting is very good.The story is about a man, a criminal who is put in a mental hospital to see if he is truly a psychopath. The way he deals with this situation, how he interacts with the other guys in the hospital, how he effects the others and how he's effected by them, friendship, true human nature... that's what this story is about!!This movie can easily bring both laughter and tears! This is one of the greatest movies ever made!!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
R. Mcmurphy is a prisoner he acts as if he's crazy to escape from penitentiary.
Then he is taken into a mental hospital
To figure out whether he's crazy or not, and this mental hospital has really strict rules, and it's an imperious and authoritative hospital, and Mcmurphy tries to spend his days there.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Every classic movie that I have seen that has won best picture and the ones that haven't, have always been good!  This one in particular is my favorite...and has easily became one of my favorite movies on my top 10, well maybe #1. First off I would just say that I also came into this movie about 2 years ago because Jack was in it...and he is my favorite actor...but after I finished the movie and was like 'WOW!'  Film making and acting at its best!!!  You can't top this as being one of the best classics...9 out of 10 !!!!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
More than art, more than emotion.
leaves you speechless and breaks your heart but gives you strenght to Live.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the greatest movies of all time
Review_body: Possibly one of the most depressingly haunting films I have ever seen. Sheer brilliance in all aspects; particularly, the acting. With brilliant performances and a story that will play with your heart, this movie is a classic in every right.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: The word masterpiece is something reserved for films that are perfect, or almost so.  This movie a wonderful cinematic achievement.  Jack Nicholson and the characters who support him create one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen in my life.  If you have not seen this movie, you have problems.  Go get it today.  It is easily one of my favorite films of all time, and it will be yours, too.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: it will warp you in a good way
Review_body: Saw this flick when I was 11 when it first arrived in Theaters. Very educational about the relationship of the individual to society.If you want a kid to understand nonconformity, get them to watch this before t is too late. The tide of conformity runs high these days, help a kid out and show them that one person can stand up, if only for a great glorious moment.Also very educational on how bureaucracy works.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Simply one of the best films ever made, a powerfully disturbing film whilst very entertaining backed up by superb acting performances.10/10.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This was fantastic acting and brilliant casting . Jack Nicholson is perfectly suited to the role of Mcmurphy . The story begins when Mcmurphy ( Jck Nicholson ) is sent to a mental institution for a crime , ( unknown ) he finds that he could make more of the hospital and introduces independence and fun to the patients there . Meanwhile , the main nurse ( Louise Fletcher ) brings him to release more anger and cause more riot due to her "stubborn" and limited ways !
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: this is a ten star movie because all the scenes were created to perfection...but my favorite scene if i had to pick one is when randall mcmurphy takes bets that he can rip that big marble sink off the floor carry it to the window and throw that entire sink through the window so they can all escape!!  (the part of this scene where he makes attempts [to do the impossible] to lift the sink from the floor). the amount of effort he put into that task.  he was hyperventilating because he was trying with EVRETHING HE HAD... after the bet was setteled he said "I TRIED, DAMIT at leastI TRIED"...now that's motivation.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Prepare to be nailed to your seat for 2 hours!
Review_body: Get ur popcorns, fluff up the couch, order that pizza and drain your weasel coz for the next two hours you watch this movie, you just can't take your eyes off. A riveting performance by Jack Nicholson arguably the best in his career, and a touching story-line and screenplay all makes this the perfect movie in every sense. Not just Nicholson but each and every character lived their part throughout the movie. Unlike some other top rated movies, the story is extremely simple. And that too adds to the overall experience. Anyone who is facing difficult time through their lives can relate to this movie with ease. Not just that, this film also criticizes the make up of our modern day society, whats wrong with it and sometimes, whats right. Im not giving away any spoilers for you have to see it to believe. This movie will be playing in your head silently in the background for quite a long time after you watch it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Read the book, it's far better than the movie!
Review_body: Fortunately not many well written books end in good movies (Forrest Gump or The Lord of the Rings are well known examples that it's possible to make a good movie) - so nor here. The director took out important elements from the text or changed it that way, that the characters presents not the way they (in the book) are. Also the "Big Nurse" isn't that diabolic as in the book (because of missing confrontations between her an the "new dangerous patient").If you read the book, expect that you'll be disappointed. If you haven't read the book yet (an probably only watched the movie) read it...and get a much better impression of the things Ken Kensey wanted to say in its great text!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" is great, It nicely covers some complicated psychological and sociological issues, Jack Nicholson did an excellent job and directing was just perfect. I'm not going to praise this movie with these clichés after all these years, I will just say one thing:you search all the basketball history, NBA play offs, Olympic finals, every single and-one streetball videos, I'm pretty sure you will not find a quarter as interesting as that couple of minutes that Mcmurphy, Chief and other psychos played "put the ball in the hole" with madhouse nurses approximately in the half way through the film .I have no doubt that that segment will make you smile. And that very smile is a moment of happiness. Catch and hold that moment with your hands, but "not too hard, you'll crush all the air out of it".
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie grabbed all the top honors and deserved them all. It earned Best Picture, actor, actress, director and screenplay. The only that was excluded was best supporting actor for brad dourif he did a very unique job for his first effort in a movie. This movie you could also add to a list of masterpieces.Rated R: Language, Sexuality, Some Violence and Drug Use
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: If you like movies that make you think...
Review_body: This is your gift from God, thinkers.This movie takes on the challenge of bringing the life of the mentally unstable to a full view for everyone to see. Everything goes on as normal (as the movie portrays it): Nurse Ratchet and crew monopolize the mentally ill in this 'institution' until a certain Mr. McMurphy comes in, rebellious, lazy, but also smart enough to get around, and almost sees the place as an easy target.I'm going to skip to the end for a second because that's where all the uncertainty comes up. McMurphy sees one of his new friends dead (did he kill himself? That question may have just come from me not paying attention) and he turns on Nurse Ratchet, trying to choke her. After all the trouble he has caused, this is the final straw. They do 'something' to morph McMurphy into what they wanted, so now he is more ill than the rest of the mental patients. Right at this moment, I stopped the movie. I had already seen the very end where the Chief kills him and runs off on a different occasion. So many questions popped into my head.I don't want to ask one without asking them all, and asking them all would break the 1,000 word limit, but watch the last half-hour, and really think about it. Who was the bad guy? McMurphy or Ratchet? That's question 1 of over 50 I thought of when I saw that part.Be ready when you watch this movie. It will leave a lasting impression.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the best films of all time.
Review_body: I only saw this film last night, and I have to say that this is one of the best films I have ever seen. From Beginning to end this film made me laugh and really touched me inside. Jack Nicholson's performance in this film is better then any other film he has starred in ( including 'The Shining').This film also won five academy awards, including: Best Actor ( Nicholson ), best actress ( Louise Fletcher ), Best picture, Best Director ( Milos Foreman ), and best adapted Screenplay.This film is so good that I have placed it in my top three favourite films, and I recommend everyone should watch this superb Drama.Overall ***** out of *****
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: ***MINOR SPOILERS***This is, without a doubt, a brilliant film.  It was well scripted, well acted, well directed, and there are few, if any, flaws.  The only problem I have with this film is how depressing it is.  I was shell shocked after I had watched it.  I didn't know what to think.  The first part of the movie was a comedy through and through.  I watched it the entire time with almost an air of smugness.  The first part was nothing compared to the second though.  The end is what makes this a brilliant and thought provoking film. My smugness disappeared  in the last twenty minutes.  Though the ending is ultimately uplifting with the fate of Chief, the events surrounding it are horrifying and depressing.  I wholeheartedly recommend this movie, but I also recommend that you prepare yourself for something other than a comedy.PS.  Does anyone know why Louise Fletcher won best actress? She was just not that good.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is in my opinion the greatest American Movie of all time (be it directed by an Eastern European and produced by a second generation Eastern European/American.It has everything I personally look for in a film. The acting is so convincing that if you didn't know otherwise you'd swear it was real. The script and ad-lib are fantastic. It's intriguing, humorous, emotionally charged, heartbreaking and politically biting all at the same time.Foreman, Douglas, Nicholson, DeVito, Lloyd and co will never (ever) top this or even get near it if they live to be a hundred.I hold this movie responsible for my failure to pass the Biology, Chemistry and Physics exams of my final year of School. The night before the papers, I was so engrossed in this movie I stayed awake until 2am and could not get back to sleep after.I know Jack Nicholson could play the standard non-conformist in his sleep but "One Flew Over The Cookoo's Nest" is the closest Hollywood has come to genius. It should be shown to anyone having a hard time fitting in, feeling a bit different, getting force-fed useless crap from teachers, bored in a tedious working environment, dominated by parents or pushed around by work management. If you watch it and absorb it it will bring out the MacMurphy in all of you.A total timeless classic because it was relevant when it was made (five years before I was born), it is relevant today and it will still be relevant after I am firmly in the ground.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Really enjoyable film with many humorous scenes as well of ones of a more serious nature.
Review_body: The overall message the film seems to portray is one of humanity and what makes somebody themselves. As well as this the is a theme of cycles and routine. There are scenes in which characters are overly joyed when they break consistency and routine such as when they are pretend to watch television and the "Christmas Party". The film touches on aspects of relationships and sex in particular with Billy, a man who has not been with a women and seems to be scared of authoritative women such as Nurse Ratched and his mother; after sleeping with Candy he and being caught he is scared of what his mother might do when she finds out and then ends up committing suicide (thus showing Billy never truly being free even after sleeping with a women)As well as this, the protagonist Randle McMurphy (Mac), is a man who likes to bet a lot as well as eager to make relationships with people, many times for his own benefit. Many times he is attempted to be subdued by various methods to make him less "dangerous" with only the final attempt working with the removal of part of his brain. His death at the end is somewhat of a mercy killing by The Chief; this was perhaps done in order to preserve the memory of Mac and the 'run to freedom' at the end of the film is the fulfilment of Mac's wishes in order to be free and break the constant cycle; Mac is also able to do by breaking the bonds that shackle him to the Earth and to be free in death.9/10
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: It may just be the best movie ever made...
Review_body: There are a handful of films that border on being perfect. But in my humble opinion, this one tops them all. I've seen this movie more times than I can remember and it still makes me angry, happy, laugh and cry every time I watch it. I've never read the book and I never really had the urge to after viewing the film. But my mother has and attests that the book is better than the film...and she loves the movie adaptation. This film made so many careers and was the first movie to make me yell at the screen in frustration. Can't recommend highly enough."Where do you suppose she lives?"
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Message is greater than what meets the eyes
Review_body: In the book, story follows a man who is sent to prison for rape of a 15 year old girl, this part is not mentioned in the movie.Did not understand and appreciate the message in the movie first. I had to read reviews and articles on the movie to understand that the author was talking about life in general. Its not about the mental asylum only. It was fun to watch Danny DeVito play one of his first roles. Pace of the movie is excellent. Liked excellent portrayal of Nurse Ratched. Some excellent camera angle work can be appreciated. You feel attached to the patients due to their acting skills. Even the ending is not straight forward one has to conceptualize and understand why and what happened. This is one of the great film endings.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Books are overrated. The movie's better.
Review_body: I'm so sick of all these people saying the book's better. Forget the stupid book. This movie's brilliant. The screenplay is brilliant. The writers took a really good novel and molded it into a perfect movie. I know all the wanna be critics that come here are gonna say how the book did this better and showed all these deep, hidden themes better and how the movie isn't as good and BLAH BLAH BLAH...that stuff is just so clichéd. I'm tired of hearing it. There's nobody in the world that could have done a better job than Foreman. The cast in this is perfect...and let me just say that I actually read the book first before seeing the movie thinking that if I saw the movie first my experience reading the book would be ruined, but the actors in the movie completely demolished the characters I had in my head; Jack Nicholson, Louis Fletcher, Brad Dourif, Christopher Lloyd...all perfect. All of them. Also, wasn't it great how the movie kept Cheswick around. God I love that guy. I think the biggest improvement that the movie had over the book was the ending. Kesey's ending lacked emotion, sensitivity, feeling...it just didn't have the impact on me that Foreman's ending did. I mean, wasn't that soundscore in the end of the movie simply amazing, I get goosebumps every time I see it. Books don't have music like that. They are, afterall, just words.I have great respect for books and novels. Harper Lee's To Kil A Mockingbird towers over the movie, but that just isn't the case here and some of you need to get over it. Some of you also need to accept the fact that not all things in books can be translated into movies. They're two separate forms of entertainment.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: The first scene of the movie portrays the most dangerous prison, the mental institution with Miss Ratched as the strictest nurse who can go to any extent to ensure that everything goes according to the laws. But very soon, inside that covered cage comes a free bird who puts up a fight against the world and tries to bring back life from its grave only to make that institution a better and a fairer place. The movie named "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" displays us the fight between a sensible individual and the omnipotent government through the characters of McMurphy and Miss Ratched. McMurphy was sent inside the mental institution after he has pleaded guilty after committing a crime. He is placed under the care of Miss Ratched who only excels in hypotinizing free minds under her evil influence. However, McMurphy always puts up a tough fight against her and questions every rule set by her. But no matter how powerful the arms of the individual it is impossible to lift the immense weight of the myths, government and the nonsensical rules of the society. McMurphy, undeterred by the consequences, goes on fighting till his last breath. But the question is "whether he will be praised as a hero by the people? Or will he be criticized as a man who was foolhardy enough to even have tried fighting the society?" Sadly the answer is that society always wins crushing the people under its foot just like hundred grain of sands are washed under the wave of the sea. The same consequences await McMurphy when iron clubs and electric shocks knock out his life breath, squeeze out the spirit of fight out of him and make him as meek as a horse. However, Chief's breakout portrayed the eventual change which is inevitable and cannot be stopped even by the iron whip of the government. This movie with the use of metaphors is fraught with a very valuable lesson that fighting the all powerful is necessary and must be carried out even though the result is fatal.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This film is one of the classic movies of the 1970s, thanks in no small measure to the talents of director Milos Forman. It was Nicholson's first Oscar win and this remains, in many ways, his signature performance. I enjoyed the picture because it is an action romance, worked out in wonderfully inventive detail and presented with mesmeric immediacy by one of the screen's most resourceful directors.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: really good movie and a really sad one
Review_body: it was a movie i will ever forget i was born after the movie came out and heck i just saw it wensday night but it really got to me i think i liked but then i think i don't it was depressing but funny it was stupid but in a smart way it was wat i think one of the best dramas i have ever seen and it had jack Nicholson which made it way better to me it was just that kinda movie that will always stick in your head and you'll always think really hard about i think deserved every single reward it got and if any of you people who think the movie sucked and are reading this well you probably either young and not very observant or your old and don't like the depressing movies but to me it was a movie that shall not be for gotten by filmmaker history
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I thought this is one of Jack Nicholson's best films. I can watch him all day he is one of my favourite actors. I'm not surprised it won 5 Oscars. His character is amazing, because he is funny, but serious. I like that in films because it shows both sides to the person. The only problem with the film was how at the end he becomes a vegetable and is then smothered with a pillow by Chief (Will Sampson). Also i hate the nurse from it she is a right witch, and I'm glad Jack tries to strangle her. It is an amazing film though, so i suggest you watch it as it will blow your mind. If you like Jack Nicholson as well i suggest you try other films such as: The Shinning, Easy Rider, Anger Management and Mars Attacks.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: ...although a difficult task, if I had to pick one film as the top of my list,this would be it.....when it came out, I watched it nearly twenty times in theaters...the best
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: This movie is the greatest ever!
Review_body: This movie is the best ever made. It has comedy, suspense, drama and murder. A awesome dialogue without too much swearing. Also the best cast you can ask for. Nicholson is the best actor to date! All in all the movie is the best!!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I have rarely seen films so good that I am left speechless.  I could talk about Nicholson's superb performance, the excellent script, the provocative social questions the film raises.... but my "analysis" of this movie would only ruin it.  All I can say is this movie is an intelligent masterpiece.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Recently got a video of this film, which I had seen on first release in 1975, for my son's 23d birthday. Watched it again. Then again. Four times total, each time more engrossing. What a perfect film: story from Ken Kesey, casting, acting, directing. What a powerful and symbolic performance from Will Sampson as Big Chief! And McMurphy: counterpoint between a living human being and the smothering, oppressive, deadening--and murderous--force of society. Scatman Crothers, Dourif, Nicholson are superb. An easy 10. I have never seen a more moving cinematic scene than the final impulsive run to freedom meshing with that unforgettable musical score.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: I don't cry easy, but I blubbed like a girl.
Review_body: Possibly the most powerful movie ever made; it just goes to show what you can do with a superb script and an excellent cast, without having to resort to explosions or special effects.Jack Nicholson has never been the most consistent of actors, but if ever an Academy Award was more deserved, I'd like to see that performance.  His McMurphy is quite simply the most believable and easiest to relate to character in the history of celluloid.  His love for the rest of the inmates is apparent all the way through, and he's backed up superbly by Louise Fletcher as Nurse Ratched, Brad Dourif (whatever happened to him?) as Billy, and Will Sampson as the Chief.  Even Danny De Vito puts in his best ever performance.McMurphy's punishment is heart-breaking, as a vibrant, intelligent small-time crook is reduced to a vegetable for daring to speak the truth, while Billy's demise is all the more tragic as it is far less inevitable than McMurphy's.I can't believe that anyone reading this hasn't yet watched the film (if not - go and watch it NOW!) but just in case - stop reading now...All I wanted to say was the scene where the Chief smothers McMurphy and then pulls the water fountain out of it's fitting and throws is through the window to escape is probably the best scene in movie history, rivaled only by the very start of Star Wars when the Star Cruiser passes overhead.Saying that this film is a perfect ten is to do it an injustice.  I defy anyone to watch this film and not be deeply moved by it.  It is a perfect example of a screenplay not needing to stick rigidly to its literary fore-runner, and for me, sets the standard for emotional dramas - a standard which no other film has yet lived up to.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Nod bad, interesting but maybe a bit overrated
Review_body: Well I enjoyed this film, its interesting and wasn't boring. But it doesn't have the depths I mean nothing to think about later, Nicholson is great and so in nurse witched, just doing their jobs, I didn't see wickensy or evil in the nurse she just did her duty. Nicholson is an actor you can't dislike, he brings life into that poor environment, but maybe he should have been more 'bad'.This isn't a perfect movie, the chief 'suddenly' begins to respond, its too easy to escape from this place, the fishing scene might be unnecessary and unrealistic, maybe was shot due to the nice views, but there are many nice scenes. Maybe time also reduces the hype over the movie. I missed some love scene between Rutched and Jack.Not bad but not so great.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Terrible (if you read and enjoyed he book)
Review_body: OK....I don't want to be one of those people who's like "the book's better" because I know that annoys people...but...IF YOU HAVE READ THE BOOK, DO NOT SEE THIS FILM!!! It will anger you beyond belief, especially if, like me, you loved the book, went online to check out the movie and saw all the awards and rave reviews, and spent $20 on the DVD before seeing it and ended up giving it away because it sickened you every time you saw it in your DVD collection (only a slight overstatement).People may like the movie who haven't read the book and that is fine, but the character of Murphy is so altered that it is maddening to watch if you've read it.I hope some more negative reviews make it up to the top of the review list, simply to warn book fans of the impending disappointment and to show them not everyone loved it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie it is awesome, this place in top 10, and thats it okey
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, is without a doubt probably one of the most influential movies, that inspires any director.The characters are bold and have a lot to tell us in this amazing yarn. You can see from the First few minutes that Jack Nicholson's character, Will bring a whole contrast of things to the mental institution.I Especially liked "Chief". In which a man as tall as a mountain, tricks everyone into thinking he is def. Throughout the movie, Randel (Jack Nicholson) stays true to his cause, a rebel. Who lives on the edge.I strongly recommend this film...
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: When first seeing this movie it became an instant favourite and to this day will defend my argument that it is best movie that has ever been made. It is the best casted movie that i have ever seen with everyone playing their roles so well and each actor comes away stealing the scene. The movie is genuinely funny with real human humour played throughout. It shows the harsh time of a mechanically run mental hospital which is interrupted by the social reality of RP McMurphy. The movie leaves you pondering on one question, Is RP McMurphy crazy or normal? The harsh reality of it is, that we today can't clearly define between the both so can't make a real judgement. Nicholsons performance is undoubtedly the best of his career and deserves a standing ovation every time it is seen. So if you have never seen this movie, rent/buy it kick back and let it bring you through (not to use a cliché - but really makes sense in this instance) a roller-coaster of emotions as you fall in love with this film as you laugh until you cry and cry until you smile.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: OK, this film was in a way the most intriguing character study in film, Jacks character is a vivacious, intense, and seemingly non remorseful man whom after many stints in jails he finally lands himself in a mental institution (cuckoos nest). The nurse a character in which you initially sympathize with turn out to be a sinister women hell bent on ruining the free mind, thinking, and speech of McMurphy..I highly recommend this movie to anyone who is looking to dive into the most fascinating character to be put to film. This movie is so accurate, in showing that some people aim to oppress this radicals towards living live in the fashion that they see fit for themselves..The acting speaks for itself flawless with a dose of vulnerability that allows even greater connection to the characters.. Don't pass up the opportunity to watch this film you will forever remember the free spirit McMurphy and you will afterward thinking, maybe i'm the one thats cuckoo..
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: well. first of all there was only three people which this film is all about, jack neckelson as Mcc-Merphy, Brad Dourif as Billy Bibbit and Will Sampson as Chief Bromden.I was amused by Mcc-Murphy and moved by Billy and finally astonished by the Indian chief.during the movie I saw the dramatic events and touched by it.near the end I was nearly crying.but THE END was beyond expectations I couldn't believe that I went all this drama and actually watched the movie and find this lame end.this movie doesn't deserve more than 4/10.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the greatest films of all time, great performances and just a great film all round!
Review_body: ONE FLEW OVER THE CUCKOO'S NEST (along with; THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION, THE GREEN MILE, GOODFELLAS, THE KING'S SPEECH and many others) is one of my favourite films ever. Jack Nicholson gives one of the best performances of his life in this classic movie. As a young writer I look at a film and I say; "Could I make this movie better or could I cast different people in this film." With this film, if I was to change it. . .I would only ruin it. There are very few films that are perfect from beginning - end this is one of those very few.A great movie and extremely worthy of the five academy awards it received in 1975. Just absolute perfection.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This was actually filmed at a mental hospital based on real people and behaviors. It's something you need to see. I work at a hospital for the criminally insane and it feels as though some bring it upon themselves. Might as well make it what you want. Just be careful for what you ask for in life.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
Last night I watched "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" for the first time ever in preparation for Ryan Murphy's "Nurse Ratched"; and I really wish I had seen it when I was younger.
By today's standards it was M I L D. Based on the torturous history of institutions and Ratched's pop-culture reputation, I was expecting Annie Wilkes and not just a nurse with a stern look trying her best to do her job with bad hair.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is the kind of movies with several levels. The first one is a story of a guy trying to escape prison until he realizes that the mental institution is worst, despite the impression it gives. A striking example is given when the nurse offers to make the patients vote on the proposition of Mc Murphy to watch baseball series on TV. First, she offers this because she knows she'll win over Mc Murphy, as the patients are too scared, too docile to publicly disagree with her. Then, she offers a second chance without mentioning that she wants the majority among people who can't vote. Finally, she argues that time was over when Mc Murphy succeeded in convincing a tenth patient. She impersonates the institution: leading you to think that they care while their only concern is to maintain their domination, their power whatsoever.Here appears the second level: a criticism of these mental institutions, answering with authority to people who simply lack the tools to behave like the majority of the population. The only violence the patients show is the one they infringe to themselves. Which leads the only two that see clearly to use it against others, but only for justice: McMurphy against the nurse who led Billy to commit suicide, and the "Chef" against McMurphy to save him from a life of physical and mental imprisonment. A third level deals with love, respect and attitude toward others in general. The main difference between McMurphy and everybody else, patients or institution, is that he treats everyone as equals, and this is what makes him the hero. His humanism is the core quality that will make him play cards with the ones that don't even understand the game (but who will say some of the most intelligent thing when asking how will they win back their money and cigarettes if the nurse keeps them "for their own good"), speak to the deaf and dumb (who appears to actually fake it), and give an opportunity for love to the one who is supposed to not be able to stand for it. And when he fails, at least, as he says in the beginning, he tries. The humiliation of him not being able to lift the block in the bathroom becomes a message of hope addressed to all of them who knew it was impossible but did not realize that the defeat is in the way they think not the fact that they were right on this matter. This key moment is a first step toward the final happy ending for the Indian guy. For all this reasons, this movie really moves me. The actors are exceptional, the grey and cold atmosphere that contrasts with the mood of the hero and with the scene of party and happiness near Christmas or with the one on the boat is perfect for the movie. I simply was not convinced by part of the end, maybe because it went too fast. I don't know. I did not like the opening credits and the poster ether, which may be details but other movies showed that these could be art and I like when filmmaker are perfectionist. Overall, I rated the movie 10/10 not because it was perfect but for all the levels I saw in it. It, for sure, will make me think about it for long, and rise questions about life in general. PS: sorry for my English, I hope it is still understandable ;)
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Watches this again for the first time in many years. Some films fade as time passes. This doesn't. Uplifting while being so sad at the same time. A classic.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I really loved this movie. Jack Nicholson as R.P. McMurphy was stunning, a not so sociable and unlikeable guy is administrated into a mental facility. As Nicholson's character meets and becomes sociable with the other patients, played by Danny DeVito, Sydney Lassick, Christopher Lloyd, Vincent Schiavelli, and Brad Dourif. All the patients are fantastic as they all have their quirks and problems, but the one that stands out is Will Sampson's performance as Chief a large def Native American who steels the show at one point. The main plot is for the patients to go up against the head nurse, Nurse Ractched played by Louise Fletcher. Who is the somewhat messed up person who is just messed up. She is menacing and awful to the patients, you end up really not liking her along with the patients. This film was released in 1975 and was directed by Milo's Forman and was based off the book by Ken Kesey. The movie absolutely deserved its best picture, lead actor, lead actress, best director, and best adapted screen play Oscars. I can't recommend this film enough.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Yes, I gave one of the greatest films of all-time a 7
Review_body: Let's start off with the positives: truly remarkable performances by every cast member, tastefully morbid comedy, heart-warming scenes that depict the human need for freedom and earthly indulgence - I don't need to go into too much detail since those of you who have already seen the movie already know why it is considered to be a cinematic masterpiece, and those of you who haven't probably already have some idea of what the hype is all about.Since this movie was released in 1975, it wouldn't be fair for me to judge it solely from the point of view of a millennial, since I believe that the rating of a movie is significantly contingent upon the time in which it was released. As such I will refrain from making any references to what a more modern audience looks for in a movie.McMurphy to me wasn't the hero everyone seems to extol him to be. He did want the best for his peers, yes, but at what cost? He took them sailing, allowing an inexperienced fellow patient to take control of the boat, without regard for everyone else's safety. He was instrumental in several riots and licentious acts within the institution. He was defiant, intractable and just plain obnoxious. I understand that many great films do feature lead characters with villainous qualities and that's okay, but the desired reaction - by the director, of the audience, to the said leads - is usually one of hatred. The movie presents itself in such a way as if we're supposed to regard McMurphy, a criminal, as the hero - and Nurse Ratched as the villain.Every plot synopsis and summary of this movie labels Nurse Ratched as the villain. Am I missing something? Was it simply because she was an ironfisted authoritarian who donned like one facial expression the whole movie? In my opinion, the same traits that point to her being the villain made her the perfect disciplinarian to the deranged and belligerent. Her style is a reminder that reformation and restoration needs tough love. I don't think she deserved to get strangled the way she did, but that was one of the great scenes in this movie.Overall, it was an entertaining movie with much to learn from. It goes without saying that these are my two cents, and I have written this review in the hopes of encouraging more objective discussion of our movies.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: A must for any human being
Review_body: One of the best and one of the most beautiful movies of all times. One of the most uplifting love poems about the human spirit. One of the most important movies that you'll see in your life. Some pieces of art are so important and so true that they can not be measured. Giving it a ten is a terrible shame, it needs more because it is one of the three or four movies that can make any human being, as chief said, as big as a mountain. And that is a beautiful thing. However, this is IMDb and it has to be analyzed as a film, so let's do it. It has a script that is just PERFECT. Acting so good that you have to concentrate really hard to pull yourself out of the spell to remember that these are actors. Directing so good that made this movie one of the most important movies of the twentieth century. A piece of art so good that makes you a better human being.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: When I watching this film I really laughed a lot. However the end was sadly.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
I have watch this movie Maybe like twenty times And i'm still not tired of it
Great acting
Great plot
😍
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: still the best English-language movie I saw in last 15 years
Review_body: When I saw that movie about 15 years ago it was a shock for me who grown in communist country. It proves that you can be free even in jail or mad house as long as you free inside yourself and that idea is the single most important idea of that movie. It's also best Jack Nicolson's movie for me. No matter how bad are the movies he does now, he remains one of the most prominent actors of all times just because of his role in One Flew ...
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is my favorite movie of all time.  I never really agree with the Best Picture Academy Award winner, (c'mon, Forrest Gump?) but this movie was well deserving.  You know the only thing better than this movie?The book.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: An eerie, powerful, nourishing drama that is something to scream about.
Review_body: The film begins as a comedy, when the plot is revealed and the bulk of the film is underway, it turns a bit darker.  The story begins to twist and spin in the most unexpected direction when finally all hell breaks loose and the audience is lost in a twirl of dramatic awe.When R.P. McMurphy fakes insanity to avoid prison, he screws around and has fun with the big joke.  But then the tables turn as reality is exposed to our little goof off and he resorts to wildness.This is not only the story of total irony (enrolling into an insane assylum healthy but then slowly turning mad, and more I could say that would spoil the movie) but of passion, tragedy and the will to live without a loved one to know your flaws.An excellent, emotional classic.  10/10.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: one of the best movies, I ever saw
Review_body: In 1976, February I fled Ceausescu's Romania for Israel. In a week time, one of my friends took me to see "One Flew Over the Cuckoo Nest". I was shocked, and till now, more than 20 years, I still think that, except "The Godfather Saga", it's the best movie ever made. May be you will be surprised, but my opinion, is that this is the best ANTI-COMMUNIST movie. Simply it shows, what crimes can be done in the name of "taking care of the well-being" of your subjects. Looking at Mrs.Fletcher as head nurse, I was thinking of Ceausescu. I am pretty sure that the director, which like, me left the "communist paradise", was thinking the same way all the way long.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: A good movie, but a little flawed
Review_body: This movie is directed by one of my favorite directors, Milos Forman. When I saw it, I expected it to be a great film.  Indeed, throughout most of the film, there was a strong theme being presented, and the film was well-made. At the end however, I expected there to be a great conclusion or a big pay-off.  But really, it kind of turned out to be an "Of Mice and Men" kind of story where two guys dream of going far away and living good lives. This did not really fit in with the movie.  However, another part of the conclusion was good where the main idea of the movie was strongly portrayed. I won't say what it is because I don't want to give any thing away, but it involves someone other than the main character dying.  So, I would say that the movie is good, but not great.  It does not measure up to Milos Forman's other films like Amadeus, Man on the Moon, and Hair.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Best film ever made about disabled people and institutions.
Review_body: While Jack Nicholson, Brad Dourif, and Louise Fletcher take top honors for their portrayals in this film, as they should, the whole point of the film as an expression of outrage against how people are marginalized in our culture, was made by Christopher Lloyd's character.  Mr. Taber (Lloyd) drops a cigarette in his pants cuff unknowingly, and it sets the pants on fire. When he reacts to the burning and danger by jumping around and yelling, he is dragged off and tied down.  People who are handicapped or mentally ill cannot express anger or fear or desire or even pain, without it being seen as a threat.  The real handicaps here are the "normal" people in the "helping professions."  Best movie of all time.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I must admit, I seriously loved the movie and especially Jack Nicholson's unbelievable performance. However, after reading the book, my opinion has definitely diminished a bit. The screenplay seems to consist simply of events of action only. The best parts of the book were the emotional rollercoasters the patients go through. Most of the best parts of the book were completely left out erasing much of the battle between Ratchet and McMurphy. I also missed the use of p.o.v through Chief Bromden's eyes. Overall, it was a great movie with unbelievable acting, however a sadly mediocre script seemed to leave out a great emotional story with an unbelievable theme.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I found this film to be quite heavy-handed. Even Jack Nicholson's edgy free spirit routine didn't convince me much.The portrayal of Nurse Ratched in particular is extremely disappointing; giving the character some depth, any glimmering of conscience or conflicted motive, might have redeemed the film. As it is she's little better than an extremely well-performed Disney villain, malevolent and rigid to the end. I can check out The Little Mermaid if I want that.If you want to feel oppressed by inherently corrupt authority figures, here's your movie. If you expected something that presents you with a moral dilemma, you'll come away disappointed. In particular, anyone who's read the book will have the sensation that it's been stomped flat in the process of being adapted for the screen.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I thought this film was one of the best ever made. Great acting by Nicholson, Fletcher, Lloyd, De Vito, Douriff, and others. What surprised me about this movie was how funny it was. I thought it would be pure drama but no, it isn't. I would've enjoyed the film more if my Dad hadn't gave away the ending, but I still enjoyed it. If you haven't seen it, watch it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Fans of novel should lighten up
Review_body: This film should be thought of as a re-imagining of the book. It may be different to the novel, but so what. The film is a good film, a separate entity to the book. When a director adapts a book to the big screen, a better film is made when they're not working within the boundaries of someone elses perception, after all, whats the point of having a carbon copy of the book on screen? Jack Nicholson is nearly always great, and it has some great impacts when its shifting from scene to scene, funny then depressing, a microcosm of emotions, a clasic film, I loved it
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie was my all-time favourite for a long time (surpassed only by "Magnolia"). It's a very well-made movie that is guaranteed to not leave you untouched at the end.Very few movies reach the heights of "One flew over the cuckoos nest" and that might be why it's number 10 on the "top 100 movies" list (was when i checked it anyways..). Go see this movie.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
Perhaps if I had written a review around the time of this film's release I would have scored it a deserving 8/10. The fact that, decades later, it has endured as a quality piece of film making that continues to tap into our deepest sentiments, scores it an extra point.
Although in places it is forced to change course from Ken Kesesy's source material in order to comply with film format, it does so with tact and satisfies all the book's intentions of its cross-examination of society.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Give more oscars to Jack Nicholson.
Review_body: JN has the face of a "crazy guy" anyway. He was born to play this kind of characters and now he developed the talent to be Oscar worthy. I watch this in 2020 - 45 years later!!! and it still is one of my favorite movies. That's it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Of course if Nicholson is in a movie you may expect more than this movie includes. Only i can consider the date of the movie why everybody gives this much high votes. I only like this movie because there are no special effects,computer made scenes or something like these. It is purely acting but unfortunately OVERRATED.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I think i've seen this movie over 40 times. It doesn't ever seem to get stale. Upon the first time watching it the performance of Jack Nicholson dominates, however with repeated viewings u start to notice just how brilliant all the other performances are. Nurse Ratchet has to rank as one of the all time movie villains and Milos Foreman,s direction is absolutely brilliant. This movie succeeds equally as a comedy and a drama. I still get a lump in my throat every time i watch it. If you haven't seen this movie, watch it. If you have seen it, watch it again. It gets better every time. If you don,t like this movie, you have no soul.....or taste.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Nnnnot as good as the book
Review_body: There are a fair few people who commented on this film that don't understand the ending. This is understandable, as when you watch the film the only conclusion you can make is that the chief is putting McMurphy out of his misery. This is not the intention I perceived the book to mean, but this is a review of the film.In all, this is a rather empty film. There isn't a lot of subtle change in the characters, which is a shame, as the more obvious changes leave the audience feeling confused (due to the lack of noticeable time lapse). This film also leaves questions unanswered, such as McMurphy's initial bet that he could break the big nurse within a week, and the doctor's love of fishing. There was also too much concentration on the board group, who really didn't do anything, and not enough development put into the Chief, the narrator of the whole story (originally).The character of Billy was the only emotional input into the film and maybe Harding's anger. The directors choice of condensing the story so a number of major events happen at once was questionable, but it worked well overall.My advice is not to judge the story based on the film. It really doesn't do the book justice and I recommend it to everyone.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: When i saw this film it actually amazed me. It wasn't just a film of one genre but encompassed many emotions and different film genres. It had moments of laugh out loud humor and intense, serious moments. The acting was impeccable and i can see why it won 5 academy awards. A film that can move you in so many different forms and emotions has got to be an excellent film.You came away from the film feeling changed in a way. The ending is pretty sad yet it starts of humorous and you feel genuine hatred towards the nurse yet also sympathy. In fact you have contrasting emotions for many of the characters.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This film really made an impact on me when I saw it the first time. Jack Nicholson is incredible in his roll as Randal P. McMurphy, and was rewarded with a 1975 Academy Award for best actor. The movie was awarded a total of five 1975 Academy Award. This movie ages with dignity, see it and see it again!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: A classic that everyone should see.
Review_body: I really like this movie.  I've seen it three times and each time I discover something new.  Its theme certainly resonates in any time period.  The whole cast, and particularly Jack Nicholson, deliver fine performances.  It's a classic and a must see.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: You've all been conned. This film is rubbish
Review_body: Who could possibly find anything worthwhile to say about this film? Obviously the 159000 plus members who collectively rated it 8.8! It's hard to imagine how the Academy could have given Awards ( the big five no less ) to this over-long piece of pretentious nonsense. Giving the Oscar to Louise Fletcher for her performance has to be the all-time joke of the movie business. That much more able actresses had turned the role down speaks for itself. With the current lack of financial wisdom in the US in 2008, however, the film obviously had some serious irony up its sleeve to be kept for 33 years down the track. Fortunately since 1975, most Award seasons have seen logic and reason return to The Academy. One can only conclude that most of the Academy members who voted this Lulu Best Picture must have been smoking the butts that Ken Kesey couldn't finish.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Everything is just about near perfect. Jack commands your attention in each scene and the support actors / actresses are giving it 110% to ensure that you are mesmerised.Very deserved of its accolades and a very moving experience, you have to really hate Jack to not like this film.This is an iconic and moving film, no argument.Want to know why it's decisive? Read on...This film played a pivotal role in my first 'real' relationship. I loved it and my then - shallow, obviously - girlfriend didn't like it, the rest of the story you can easily guess.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: The movie exists to show not only how corrupt and poorly-constructed society's approach to the "mentally unstable" is, but it creates characters that we have all met in life and shows how the McMurphy-like figure that we all wish we had fights for freedom of choice and basic human rights. In addition to the movie's great spirit, the acting is fantastic. Jack Nicholson is at his best and Danny DeVito can be seen in his very first acting role ( which he absolutely triumphs in ). And of course, there's the unforgettable Chief Bromden. The directing by Milos Forman is very well-done, as the camera-work is excellent and follows the pace of the movie perfectly in how it is used. What really impressed me was the editing, especially as far as the use of audio goes: some parts just made me go "...wow." My only complaint is that I believe the movie could've been slightly more effective if it were based more closely on the novel at certain points, but the modified point of view of the film does make a great point; anyone who has ever hated their job, been accused of something, had some person so self-righteous and convinced of their own authority and dependency on order get in your way, or attended the American public school system at any point in their life should be able to identify with this movie.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: One flew over the cuckoos nest is a wonderful story of a guy named Mcmurphy who fakes being crazy by committing crimes. He goes to a mental hospital where he tries to escape multiple times.There's humor, sadness, happiness, and themes intertwined in this wonderful movie that also won the big five Oscars. the ending is a little stale but its still a good one. The characters were played by regular people but sold it as mental people. Like Christopher Lloyd and Danny DeVito. The writing in it is better than almost all modern movies. The nurses are wonderfully displayed and seem real like Nurse Ratchet. I would recommend this to anyone with a soul
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This may indeed be perfect cinema!It has everything a film needs in my view. The message of the film is subtle yet clear enough for all to grasp. The main theme (there are many) to me was 'What is madness? Where does the line get drawn? and If McMurphy is mad then what are you?'The issue if insanity is essential for all humans to explore as we may be closer than we think to it at any given point in our lives. Not just old age! But like all great films, Milos Forman skilfully teases us and does not give any concrete answers. Like life itself, all is ambiguous and incomplete and mysterious.The story is warm yet cold, funny yet tragic, beautiful yet ugly, entertaining yet important. How did they do it? That's the mystery of a great film!One thing I know...'at least I tried...god damit...at least I did that.' is the greatest scene and quote in cinema that I know.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I cannot overrate this movie. I watched it last night so I'm writing this review with it still fresh in mind. I had high expectations knowing all the rewards that rained down on it, but the film and Jack Nicholson's performance in particular still managed to surprise me.R.P. McMurphy (Jack Nicholson) is transferred to a mental institution for evaluation after given a short sentence on a prison farm for statutory rape charges. He tries to make the most of his suspected short stay in the hospital and challenges the head nurse (Louise Fletcher) at every chance he gets.Anthony Hopkins has done a great intelligent psychopath, but no one does crazy better than Nicholson. I loved his performance in "The Shining" and am ashamed to say I have yet to see "As Good as it Gets" (one of three movies he won best actor Oscars for). He delivered an average performance in "The Departed" and isn't getting any younger, but I do hope he gives us at least one more role that comes close to the show he put on in Cuckoo's Nest. Watching his interaction with the other patients made me believe on some occasions I was seeing a comedy, but the movie quickly reminds us it can be just as depressing as it is funny.It's hard to find fault with "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest". Louise Fletcher did a great job as the leading actress and strong performances by all the supporting characters made the movie brilliant. Good screenplay, good directing and the music by Jack Nitzsche played nicely with the film.I've seen some hate about the ending, but in my opinion it couldn't have been better. McMurthy could have jump out of the window when he had the chance and I think most of us were rooting for him to do so, but what he does next shows the strong bond formed with his odd friends inside the hospital.The movie left me emotionally blank for a while and then I just felt sad. I'm not going to drop any major spoilers on this site as I know some of you still haven't seen it, but it's one of the few movies that have truly left me staring at the end credits in awe.Conclusion:It ranks as one of the best in my book alongside "The Shawshank Redemption" and "Pulp Fiction". See this movie with the highest expectations and chances are it will surpass them!250moviereviews.wordpress.com
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Great experience woven of different kinds of feelings
Review_body: Sharp and shortThe movie is a true masterpiece directed by Milo Forman followed by brilliant performance by Jack Nicholson. It is about criminal who pleads insanity to avoid conflict with authorities after getting into trouble. As the result, they put him in a mental institution along the other patients and oppressive nurse beautifully portrayed by Louise Fletcher. He starts rebellion against the staff, particularly against the nurse. This movie shows us on a unique way, which combines drama, thriller and a little bit of comedy, how social system can destroy an individual and the rebellion against the stuff actually represents rebellion against the system. Window breaking at the end is really impressive considering parallel with real life. The point is: bad system, sooner or later, has to fall, with casualties. One decisive man is all you need to rally up the mass and start a revolution. There are some breathtaking scenes like McMurphy's returning from the treatment, playing basketball with other patients or acting like there is a baseball game going on the TV. This situations provoke different kinds of feelings in viewers which provides unrepeatable experience watching the movie. Acting is also the thing we have to mention multiple times because Jack and Louise (and not only those two) showed their best performances and made this movie and their roles unforgettable. Among the other movies which have same or similar subjects as the main theme, we can surely say that One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is one of the best and it must be considered like one of the best movies ever, not only in this genre.Perfect!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the most mesmerising films I've seen.
