Review_body: "One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest" is one of those films, that takes you by the hand and shows you a world of madness through sane eyes, just so you can understand how humans react to that which is different. In a way, it lets the viewer criticize certain aspects of Asylum policies in the 70's and the 80's, and slowly retracts from being the one doing the critique. Incredibly memorable cinematography, haunting colors and dialogue that truly brings an honest element to "crazy", otherwise not expected. Stunning Milos Forman, mind-blowingly good Jack Nicholson - both- as always.I will never forget this movie. A must watch!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: so, it's me again boys. let us start at the start. The first half of the film was pretty banging, since i thought the acting was superb, but personally I thought that the whole directorial of the film was a let down. Jack Nicholas is cool though. the sideman was also a really good actor and I thought his use of movement to convey emotions was beautiful. however the film seemed very disjointed and not very well put together. so this review is over an I need to fill up these ten lines so I'm going to insert something my good mate Kieran said about the film; "personally I've never seen the movie, but deep down I know it's an absolute banger. I've got a feeling you know." personally I don't agree with the lad, but take from it what you will. I'd also like to leave a link to my good friend FreckleFacegGaming: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeoefoNfUV8ho0iY6rmBWBw. he's a rising youtube star and I'd love it if you guys could go give him some love. :)
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I am talking about everything. Everything is great in this movie, but it lacks one important element that always satisfies me when I watch any kind of movie.NB: Because English is not my native language, perhaps I didn't understand the main idea of the movie. If so, please correct me. Until now however my review is a bit objective.Jack Nicolson rocks as well as every other thing. The missing element is the lack of resolution.The movie goes well, it tells you what's the problem is about. However, it does not solve the problem! Which means that the message is incomplete. Every movie must offer the problem to find the solution for it, but in this movie Jack Nicolson had the problem being sick, and all the time I've been expecting how he's going to get cured there. Though, I was disappointed.Probably the movie was meant to be realistic and surprise you with un-expected endings, but it's not about that. I noticed the problem the message of the movie is trying to reveal, where is the solution? That Jack Nicolson died? Is that it? Because of this crucial missing element, I couldn't give this movie more than 7. Perhaps the message is: Life Is Tough, but we all know that don't we? But when we watch a movie, we try to know something new about life; for example, how to solve Mc Murfy's sickness, in real-life cases.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie is something most people have seen, and for those who haven't' seen it, I highly recommend you to see it. The plot is riveting. I've seen many movies in life, but this is one of the very best I've ever seen. All the other "nuthouse" movies that were made after merely had the hopes of surpassing this one in terms of being remembered. Won't happen. Maybe this movie was so great because it was the first of its kind, but it's still amazing. The ending is very sad, but it's also unavoidable. Really don't want to give anything away, so you'll have to watch it yourself.Despite the facts this movie is a drama, it still has funny parts. Overall the movie is something that will always be remembered for causing changes in the mental hospital status. As a bit of trivia, the mental health "profession" actually hated this movie once they heard what it was about. There were even several attempts by the mental health profession to boycott the movie. Again, I advise anyone interested in a good flick to watch this.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is an absolutely astonishing film that is without doubt the finest I have ever seen. Jack Nicholson's performance is certainly his best one, and maybe one of the greatest of all time. Yet Louise Fletcher very nearly equals him in a chilling portrayal of a woman so devoid of any emotion she seems almost robotic.I had read the book when I first watched it, so was prepared for the wide range of emotions that would be on display. But nothing quite prepared me for what I would see, I was most surprised at how funny it was, some scenes played purely for comedy.The ending completely floored me, the sudden switch from comedy to terrible, devastating tragedy was shattering. I absolutely recommend this film to anyone and everyone.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I can watch this movie time and time again. Nicholson has a stellar performance here. Also shows at how mental health facilities are, in truth. It has happy, joyful moments and dark, sad ones. My perfect combination.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Only one sentence is enough for stating my review: This film is better than "Shawshank Redemption".
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Not sure why it's so popular
Review_body: Had a terrible day at office, so decided to wind down with this classic which was on my watchlist for a long time. I had high expectations from this movie. I mean it is ranked 18 on IMDB top list, so there has to be something riveting about this movie, right? Entire 2+ hours went into that search. It's not a bad movie, not at all. I loved the nurse's character and her performance. You will also feel sad for the patients that go through the tyrannical abuse. The ending is sad and makes you ponder. And that's it. Seriously, what is this movie doing in the top 20 list? I think I'd have liked the movie better if I didn't have very high expectations riding on it due to its high rating and number of oscar wins. May be it was one of its kind when it came out in the 70s but now it's more of an above average drama movie.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: A solid 10 for Jack😎 that's all there is to say about it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This film is my favourite drama ever. Hard hitting and thought provoking.....this film highlights the enormous failings of our metal health systems, which were (and probably still are) not curing or encouraging recovery....but containing and controlling.In this movie we see our main characters optimism and rebellious ways start to help the other inmates improve and recover from their problems....In the end we see our leading lady playing the nurse not only undo soem healthy recovery ..... but actually prey of his insecurities and drive him to a terrible end. Our lead man loses it and I felt all his anger and could see myself acting as he did in shear rage.....this is one of the strongest most emotional moments of any film i have ever watched, but brilliantly the gloom is tempered with a glourious ending of sublime hope.A remarkable story, brilliantly played by all the cast.....superb
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Honestly it's just one of the best movies I've ever seen. JUST WATCH IT
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: The movie does flies over the cuckoo's nest
Review_body: This was my first VCD collection which I owned. The feel of this movie is very very electric indeed. Especially the high voltage clash between Nicholoson and Ms. Fletcher. For me the high point of the movie is the way the entire story telling, the brilliant cast and their performance merge seamlessly with the theme of the movie which is at the backdrop and gets unleashed only in the end with the Chief doing what he does in the end. The book is equally emphatic. Brad Dourif shines like a gem and so does Mr. Devito.Awesome movie indeed.Avinash.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I had never seen the movie for I was born the same year (!)It is one of the best movies ever produced in my opinion. It is too bad that today's film producers don't often create quality films like this one.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is one of the very rare time-less movies; even though it has been released 6 years before my birthday, it is much more actual in content than many other movies of our time. Despite the fact that Nicholson latest films (except As good as it gets) aren't very brilliant, this one is the ABSOLUTE BEST MOVIE OF ALL TIMES. The cast is simply amazing, Lloyd, Sampson, DeVito and the touching character of Billy ....... and being honest, who didn't want Nicholson to get rid of that nurse at the end ? The finals scene showed the greatness of the movie once again, powerful and drammatic !I absolutely loved it and it's a shame that almost noone of my generation knows it
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: My all time personal favorite.  Shocking how many people of my generation have failed to see this.  Nicholson's finest performance by far, and Forman's best work as director.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Jack Nicholson plays what is possibly his career best in this cinematic gem. In his trademark role as an unpredictable and slightly manic outsider, he plays an offender (Randle McMurphy) committed to a mental asylum, where he attempts to brighten up the regimented and empty lives of the unfortunate patients.A powerful moral current runs through the film, and the viewer becomes very involved in sharing McMurphy's frustration at being oppressed by the system, with its allotted medication times and electrocution for those who step out of line. The result is a very moving story, where you enjoy the highs of McMurphy's efforts (fishing trip, the World Series, party), but are contrastively disturbed by the lows.The characterization is excellent, and portrayed very well by a strong cast including Christopher Lloyd and Danny DeVito. The script allows this diverse selection of individual talents to come across very well.If this film doesn't hit you emotionally, then you are a psychopath and should be locked up for intense sessions of therapy yourself. This flick is made of powerful stuff. Really.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie is just incredible.  It leaves me motionless from beginning to end, and I can't say that about most films.  Totally encompassing as the drama of the situation plays out in front of you.  Forman's best work as a director, and equalled by the script and cast.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This one oozes class. No one can argue with the top five Oscars (Best Actor; Actress; Picture; Director and Screenplay) the superb cast who have all gone on to do some amazing films. Most notably Christopher Lloyd (Back To The Future Trilogy and Addams Family), and Danny De Vito (The list is endless with the amount of great films he has appeared in). This film has a great moral message to all watching and was used as a eye-opener to many a problem faced by "lunatics".
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie was completely captivating from the start to the finish.  Jack Nicholson was amazing as "the normal" guy put in a cuckoo's nest, instigating all the fun and trouble.  It just goes to show that sometimes being put away and medicated isn't the only cure for people who are deemed insane.  Sometimes all it takes is just a change of pace and a little touch of personality which Jack Nicholson provides plenty.  This has to be one of my all-time favorite movies!  I gave it a 10.  And for all who haven't seen this movie, don't be wasting your time reading my comments, rent the movie!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the worst films ever made!!!
Review_body: After having read the book and seen the play (Little Fox Theater in San Francisco), I have to say this is the worst movie I have ever seen. I suppose having previous exposure to Kesey's work before seeing the movie spoiled me. I was expecting to see a great book made into a great movie. The movie Murphy was a totally different person than the book Murphy. The book Murphy instilled in the other patient a new found sense of self. In the movie, Murphy replaces the staff as the authority figure. The patients did what Murphy said, much the same as they did with the hospital staff. All in all an extremely pathetic translation to film.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: So i have never really seen this movie, or have even heard of this movie. But i have stumbles acrossed it this is kinda happening now. so hi how was your day? i hope it was good. just kidding im gonna be mean and say i hope it wasnt great. mine wasnt that good because my mom or dad werent able to bring me and lunch because they were stuck in like meetings and stuff and the maid was ¨able" to bring it either. so im having my dad fire her as soon as i get home! and my new tv isnt coming in early anymore! so im still stuck 60 inch. someone please email me to make my day better. thanks
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Fantastic acting but on the whole a disappointment
Review_body: Having watch this film once, I felt I must have quite drastically missed a major point to the film. Being in the IMDb top 250, I felt I owed the film further viewing, but this was only to disappoint me again! Don't get me wrong - I can appreciate the perhaps cutting edge setting of the film, & the raw emotional issues it tackles (in a particularly quirky way!), but I felt the screenplay overall was somewhat lacking. On the plus side, Nicholson & Fletcher fully deserved their Best Actor & Best Actress academy awards, with superb support from fellow inmates (noting especially Lloyd & Dourif, in what I believe was Dourif's first film?). Please feel free to e-mail me & discuss, especially if you disagree with any comments, but One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest; a disappointing 6.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie is easily one of the greatest films ever created. The acting, cinematography, the score, it just comes together so well. This movie greatly captures the human spirit and accurately shows the inner workings of something I think all of us feel in our lives. Nicholson portrays the rebellious patient so perfectly and gives us something we can relate to in one way or another, especially in the way he deals with the corrupt nurses and the hospital. He refuses to give in to their mold and continues to do what he believes in and does not conform in any way. This movie makes you feel a wide range of emotions when the credits roll, making you reflect on your life and the way you deal with others and your own life decisions. A truly special movie that is perfect in every way.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: For me, this film is very tough to rate because the book is one of my all-time favourites. So let's be fair, Nicholson gives an excellent performance as McMurphy, his chemistry with the other actors is great and really gets you, the viewer, on his side with his likable persona. The supporting cast also gives a strong performance, providing the perfect pitch of crazy that is required and Nurse Ratched providing an instantly unlikable presence. So, if i had seen this film without reading the book i would probably be able to give it a higher mark but...well now the problem begins because, you see, the novel is perfect and the film is not wholly true to the novel. The major thing that really bothered me right from the beginning was Nicholson. Nicholson could never be McMurphy truly because he just does not have the physical presence that is required for a rugged street fighter type, it was a battle he could never win. The other problem for me was that the darker side of McMurphy wasn't shown as well as it could have been, meaning that the character could (and should) have had more depth. Chief Brompton was cast perfectly though (his character could have been given more attention though). So in summary, great film, see it...but read the book first, even if it blights the film, its worth it!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I love this movie. Wonderful adaptation of a novel.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: A Climax stoping half way of a fantastic movie.
Review_body: A good movie, as the other following comments might have informed you about wat the movie is about, i find it a nice story with allot of humor and drama combined. Other people told me it was a fantastic movie, others told me i had to be psychologically prepared for it, others told me its a movie i have to see. I did, i thought it was a great movie,but the end surprised me. I had the idea the end was the middle of the movie and there was much more to expect. Seeing the credits and the way Chief brake out, i found out it was the end of a good movie. Being one of the few people giving an unsatisfied comment on this movie i still really liked it but, do not get your hopes up that it'll be a fantastic great marvelous movie. Beacaus your fantasized idea at the beginning of the movie is always greater then the movie itself. 'Ignore what others have told you, and you will find loving this movie more then i did' I will see this movie again another time without thinking it has just started and ill enjoy this movie from the very start.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: The Cuckoo's Nest.I like this movie a lot.P.S. They're telling me my review is too short. What do you want from me, an entire paragraph? There's my review. Enough already!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
Wow. I was moved by this movie. Amazing actors and actresses, great story. Keeps you thinking. Just wow. Let me put my thoughts in words.First of all actors. Oh my god at first Jack god damn Nicholson ladies and gentleman, I've never seen such a good actor group in the same movie. Legendary actors play as side characters and they do an amazing job of course. There isn't a single time I thought "Huh... That seemed off." actors that play as mental ill people are so natural you don't ever doubt them. Actresses that play as doctors are such real characters. Male nurses are so real aswell. You can feel their emotions, what they must feel like. You connect with every character.
In general I'm gonna give acting a 10/10Storyline is amazing aswell. There were a few times I felt boring but still the movie did an amazing job on story.This movie is so ahead of his time. You can watch this movie in 2020, 2050, 2090 doesn't matter this is a must watch and a masterpiece.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: It really do be like that sometimes, huh? Imdb please i just want to validate my account. Please let me submit this piece of shit review already.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Two Words: Jack Nicholson. You'll learn to care and feel for J.P. McMurphy during watching this film. The actors all around him are also excellent. It's not the Winning Oscars that get my attention, it's the great acting and great story that's unique, touching, real to life, and frightening.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: When this came out. I saw it at the cinema. I saw it 3 times during its 2 week run. To say that I was affected is an understatement. A defining moment in cinema in the 1970's.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Ken Kesey would take mescaline and go to work. That he labored in a mental institution explains the impetus for the film which can be summed up with one quotation, "Whoso would be a man, must be a non-conformist."I seriously doubt Kesey had Emerson in mind, but rather,himself. At every turn presented in life, Mr. Kesey choose the other path...many times even if it did not exist.Perhaps he recognized that sometimes it is better to swallow principles and survive. SPOILER But then he had to'ruin' it with the final liberation of the chief.I've read the book, saw the play in Greenwich Village (1972)and of course the movie. I think the adaptation was very well done, Mr. Keseys' remarks, notwithstanding.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: one of the the greatest films ever made
Review_body: this movie ,simply put is the greatest drama ever made.the cast is so superb that one cannot believe it.jack nicholson gives his best performance,period.and that is saying a LOT.not to mention that louise fletcher plays the most chilling villain that film has ever seen.in the scene in which a character gets dragged off, stuttering like a madman literally sends chills down your back. saying any more would be giving away the plot to one of the great films of all time. seeing this movie will move you, uplift you , and also make you think "one flew over the cukoo's nest" will do that to you.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Funny but still touching movie about how raw Human race can be.
Review_body: I've seen a lot of movies. And by a lot I mean A lot. Never have I felt like i did when watching One Flew Over The Cuckoos Nest. Kind of late commenting it now but this movie is one of a kind. I am a big fan of Sci-fi, Star Wars, The Matrix etc. One Flew Over The Cuckoos Nest Is the best movie EVER made. If you haven't seen you probably know something about it. When you start watch you understand from the beginning that this movie ain't going to have a "happy" ending. I laugh when jokes are made but i also feel sad because I can guess from what i've heard and by what I see what's going to happen. And finally it does.Don't just walk around and think for yourself that someday, someday I am going to take the time and watch it. Just do IT, NOW! I wont write about the story, you either find it out by yourself or just don't mind knowing. You just don't need to know.//Viktor from Sweden
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Jack Nicholson turns in his finest performance of all time as con Randle McMurphy. McMurphy doesn't like prison life so he decides to get a transfer to the mental institution, pretending to be a nut, for a cushier life. Halt! Enter Nurse Mildred Ratchett (Louise Fletcher) who grinds McMurphy down until he ends up labotamised and turned into a live cabbage. Not before Nicholson takes the patients on a fishing trip, throws a party in the ward with women and plenty of booze and of course his world series rant, where he commentates on the world series after nurse ratchett won't allow the patients to watch the game like she said she would. A great movie directed by Czech Milos Foreman, which was the movie Jack Nicholson was born to star in. Also an impressive supporting cast Christopher Lloyd and Danny De Vito spring to mind.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This film is simply superb! Jack Nicholson "SHINES" as R P McMurphy with a cast of fellow actors to die for. Scatman Crothers as "Orderly Turkle" and Brad Dourif as "Billy Bibbit" from the Exorcist 3 lend support, humour and tragedy to this greatest of films. My only further comment is- Get off the Internet, found out where to borrow or buy it and watch it!..........Now
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Greatest comedy drama ever made. Nicholson's best acting.
Review_body: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest must be recognized as one of the best comedy dramas in existance.The acting, the directing, and the writing are far better then any Academy Award can notice. Jack Nicholson was at his best in this film and made R.P. McMurphy one the most notable and quotable characters in movie history. Louise Fletcher portrayed one of the best villians of that era. And who could forget the cheif and his Juicy Fruit. Along with one of the best supporting casts to be assembled, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is definilty a favorite of movie lovers past, present, and future.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Many people who want to cheat the system fail in succeeding, for example Randal Mc Murphy, from the movie "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's nest", tries to pass as a mentally ill patient but only ends with his death. As many movies have symbols that a reader can connect to, moral values are shown to make a movie meaningful ass well the movie can also have two characters which personalities stand out, and show a theme embraced by the actors, thus, creating a classic that will be shown to future generations for its values shown in the movie. From birth many parents teach their children moral values: Do not steal, no profanity, and always tell the truth, these are a few examples that can be used and remembered into shaping child's mind, later on creating a good citizen. As well as the opposite, some may not have had the chance to have a parental figure in their life so they can grow up emotionless and can end up a psychotic killer or a murderer(like Mc Murphy). In the movie, Mc Murphy lies his way through life and throughout his jail sentence and the mental ward showing how he only thinks about himself and always tries to beat the judicial system. As the lies continue to spread, Mc Murphy also manipulates the other patients and takes away their "treats" a manipulation that Nurse Ratched observes. Throughout the movie his behavior changes slightly as he shares the happiness of being free with his fellow friends from the mental ward. As moral values have been lost for Mc Murphy, the nurse Ratched has built a mental ward from values that create a friendly atmosphere and a place where communication is widely accepted. Nurse Ratched is the type of person who believes that all people are good or have good in them, and if they are mislead by vices or bad habits she can help them to a better path. As a nurturer, she takes care and lookouts for all the patients in the ward, even Mc Murphy. In the movie Nurse Ratched is viewed as the supreme authority, a figure that Mc Murphy is attracted to but at the same time despises a figure that Mc Murphy always tries to cheat and lie to. Mc Murphy can be viewed as the common thief, one who breaks all the rules, a rebel, a person who defies the authority and at the same time tries to cheat the justice system. A type of person who always looks for the easy way out, a person who through his behavior makes him always ends up with conflict with the authorities; he is also, in my opinion, a person who many people want to be but have a fear of being that person. Due to moral values and how society views these "rebels" the type of behavior Mc Murphy shows is repressed in us. His behavior makes him have an assault-battery-rape convict that makes him find an alternate choice to finishing his jail sentence. His behavior then changes to a caring friend, a friend who the whole ward admires, an admiration that made the Chief (the mute) talk. With these new friendships he puts all his attention on the Chief; he is the only person that understands Mc Murphy and also wants to be free from the ward, the medicine, and especially the other patients. The theme is based on how cheating the system can never happen without worse consequences happening. An act that punishes the person who tries to beat or cheat the system, for example, Mc Murphy, his jail sentence was actually made longer because his stay in the mental ward would be for life. As he finally understood how his plan fell apart he did not use his judgment but instead went on an impulse to flee from the ward. A thought that Mc Murphy could not stand, a thought that made him make foolish decisions to jeopardize his plan of escape. As time comes and goes, the moral values that have been shown throughout the movie will forever stay with me. The lesson learned here can make me choose between learning from Mc Murphy's mistake or learning the hard way and ending up dead from the foolish choice of trying to beat the system. The characters created an environment that in an odd way I related to them by showing how Mc Murphy is part of me that is trapped inside held by a conscience and high moral values that were thought to me.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie is 8th in the world according to IMDb and I'm not surprised. I saw the movie first a few years ago with my dad and enjoyed it, but not I'm a bit older, I understand the movie is spectacular! Nicholson is amazing in it, his best movie and he has done very well in other movies including bucket list but this was amazing. All the characters you are supposed to love, you simply love and Nicholson's character 'Mc Murphy' and Chief have amazing chemistry and have a very special bond. But the best part of the movie, is when they pretend they are watching the world series and have a great time. A perfect movie and a must see for anyone!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I love this film, it just has everything.. actually just thinking about it makes me wanna go and watch it again now. Jack acting is superb and really believable. What really grabbed about this film is its almost uplifting quality that makes you want to go out and do something positive, well it did for me anyway! One thing I would say is once you watch this you wont be able to read the book without seeing and hearing jacks character which makes it very difficult to get into, maybe thats just me though. What more can you say really? I love it and earge anyone to watch it and defy you not to be extremely moved by this great story
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: The Movie which can drive you mad and make you sad
Review_body: A small Hospital with a bunch of fifty crazy guys, an arrogant and callous nurse, a convict who enters this MAD PLACE with lot of thrill and anticipation in his face and a low lighting environment. What do you expect?Let me cut it short. If you watch this movie alone you won't be able to smile for the next three hours .(Period)The characters are so intensely crafted by the director. You can feel the madness that our protagonist experiences in this 'Cuckoo's nest'. We can judge a movie by 3H parameter (Proud to say that I am the guru who invented it), Happiness, Hope and Hate. This Movie satisfies all the three.Happy for our chief flying over the cuckoo's nest Hope, when we see the smiling faces of the inmates and Hate that develops towards the arrogant nurse.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: The movie is perhaps more comedy and entertainment than drama. Still that doesn't mean that the movie isn't filled with some powerful emotional acting. The tension between the patients and the staff becomes obvious and grows throughout the movie, which eventually leads to a tremendous ending. The supporting cast, Louise Fletcher, Danny DeVito, Christopher Lloyd, and Brad Dourif also give terrific performances. Danny, Christopher, and Brad's careers took off from this classic movie. It's all sentimental, funny, dramatic, intense, chilling, disturbing, diverting, and tragic. The finale leaves the viewer stunned and sitting there thinking about what he just saw.I think you will find, its one of the best movies of its time.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Jack Nicholson plays McMurphy as if he were born to it in this hilarious and heartbreaking classic.
Review_body: McMurphy is an Irish-American brawler found culpable of battery and gambling. He is a Korean War veteran who was also held as a prisoner of war. He is sentenced to a fairly short prison term, and decides to have himself declared insane in order to be shifted to a mental institution, where he expects to serve the rest of his time in comfort and luxury.Randle Patrick McMurphy appears on the well-organized and claustrophobic scene of the psychiatric ward like a bolt from the blue in the movie, "One Flew over the Cuckoo's Nest." He is a sharp-witted, elegant, aggressive, and an energetic person who always challenges the status quo from day one. He introduces himself to all and sundry in the ward, shakes hands and fills the silence with loud laughter. He is perhaps not mentally ill; he has chosen to be sent to the psychiatric hospital because he did not like to work on the prison farm, where he had six months to go before his discharge. The desirability of the psychiatric hospital for him was the idea of enjoying better food and a trouble-free lifestyle. This is not exactly what he actually gets.McMurphy has brought a touch of normalcy in the general atmosphere of the ward with his sense of humor and rebellious voice. He instantly engages in a long, hopeless, and endless battle with a "Big Nurse". What Nurse Ratched wants is a group of passive and silent men who do not offend or query how she has ordered things. It is their incarceration, voluntary or otherwise, upon which her job and role in life depends. Hence, McMurphy is the ultimate threat—a nonconformist who encourages the residents into a desire for action. He provokes them up out of the lifelessness and dullness in which they have been dwelling. In fact, he provides them with the creation of a treatment to their problems. The more victorious McMurphy is at disturbing the status quo, the more severe the battle becomes between him and Nurse Ratched. McMurphy is a very funny character but the humor ends when he discovers that Big Nurse has complete control over his fate—over what treatment he receives and when he is discharged. What starts as a boisterous mutiny against authority becomes a calamity. McMurphy is repetitively subjected to electric shock therapy. He manages to joke about it and to gather the strength to arrange a fishing expedition for some of the men. Finally, he makes a plan to escape one night but before that he invites everyone to a night of drinking and partying in the ward. The drunken orgy, complete with prostitutes, turns into a debacle and becomes the cause of his demise. Big Nurse comes to know about the party and sends him for electro-shock treatment. He returns lobotomized, as a human vegetable, after the therapy. All the lights in his bright mind and brave personality have been extinguished due to continual electro-shock therapy. Afterwards, his trusted friend "Chief" asphyxiates him with a pillow and saves half-living McMurphy from sinking into a vegetative existence. In spite of his final degradation to a vegetative state, he wins the fight for freedom that he has fought so courageously.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is movie directed by Milos Forman. It is about a man named Randle Patrick McMurphy, a character played amazingly by Jack Nicholson, who is on a trail bases on a mental hospital so they can evaluate him if he is crazy or not. It was McMurphy scheme to be in that place so he doesn't have to go to prison. He met few people there and showed them a very good time. Is trail was over and the doctors had concluded that he is not crazy but Nurse Ratchet, played by Louise Fletcher, thought otherwise and suggested that he should stay so they can heal him. While in the institution he met a deaf huge Indian named Chief Bromden, played by Will Sampson. Later he found out that McMurphy found out that he was faking it. Together they planed an escape. Mcmurphy had a late night party for his farewell. Soon after enjoying they all passed out and Billy Bibbit played by Brad Dourif slept with a party girl Candy. Nurse was very upset and angered and threatened to call billy's mother. Billy in anger committed suicide. Rage took over McMurphy and he tried to choke Nurse Ratchet, but was unsuccessful and after that moment McMurphy became mentally ill due to the death of Billy.The film is rated R but kid who have the knowledge of bad word can enjoy this film. The movie has a funny theme at the start but then changed to serious with a little drama after the party. The acting done by people in this movie is superb. Many actors and actress had a career defying role and became very famous people. It won 5 Oscar including the Best Actor in a Leading Role, Best Actress in a Leading Role Best Director and Best Picture and had many other wins.It was a great movie and is must watch by all
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the Greatest Movies Ever
Review_body: Need I say more?  The acting, the directing, the screenplay, the cinematography.  It's so superb I am lost for words.  Jack Nicholson displays arguably his best acting performance, next to movies such as Chinatown, The Shining, and About Schmidt.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: If you did not watched the movie or read the book, you have missed an great experience, an great lesson. Even those who don't like the story have to admit it is still great in the meaning of it. I know this sounds floating, hippy like or crazy, but isn't that suitable. For this movie?And of course, in this movie Jack is again an great actor. I can't really name a thing that I did not like about the movie except of course the differences between the movie and book. But aren't they always there? A book never get fully filmed, for some reason there has to be action in it. I hope others will enjoy this movie as much as I did.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: How can a movie be so complete?
Review_body: For a long time I was so eager to see this movie, and one evening I couldn't wait anymore. Me and a good friend went in to the city and rented "One flew over the cuckoo's nest".After watching the two hours and 9 minutes long movie, I was really so impressed, that I couldn't wait to see it again, so some weeks later I bought it on DVD. After watching it a couple of times, it made me realize how spectacular it actually is. I don't think I've seen such a complete movie, it almost got everything a movie can content. I don't think there's a single thing that could have been different, for making this movie better. The set, the characters and the story is all so magnificent, so near perfect."One flew over the cuckoo's nest" is one of my top 3 favorite movies, just as Jack Nicholson and Milos Forman goes on my list to, for being some of the greatest men in entertaining ever. All the Oscar's this movie was given, they're symbols of how perfect this movie is. I will say, that this is probably on the top 5 movies of all time, so it gets my full credit.10/10
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is by far my favorite Nicholson movie. It includes an amazing cast that includes actors such as Danny DeVito as Martini and Christopher Lloyd as Max. The entire cast is great and the movie is just one hilarious line after another. Jack Nicholson nails the character because you don't know if he really is crazy or just acting crazy. It won each other big 5 at the golden globes and is by far won of the greatest films to be made. The character Randle McMurphy loves steering up a mess and the Nurse Ratchet played by Louise Fletcher is one of the greatest screen villains she literally comes off as a coldhearted person like the character was intended to be. Overall it is a complete joy ride and a movie that everyone should see.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is an absolutely fantastic film but I have one issue with it that is kind of hard to look past. I read the book before I watched the movie and when I do that I try really hard to keep my opinions on the two mediums separate. I understand that what works well in a book can't work for a film and vice versa. The movie is a really great adaptation. All the performances are fantastic (especially Jack Nicholson's) and it just looks really great. But, and here's my issue, the ending of the movie doesn't fit. And by ending I mean that literal last scene where Chief Bromden kills R.P. McMurphy and escapes. Now, the scene plays out exactly like it does in the book which was great to watch but it just doesn't fit with the movie. One thing they changed was the point of view. The book is told from Chief's point of view and is ultimately his story of how he grows through watching R.P. McMurphy. The movie, on the other hand, is changed to be R.P. McMurphy's story. But the ending is the same. The movie, which is about McMurphy, ends with Chief's redemption. If they just fixed the ending to fit better with McMurphy's story then the movie could be perfect.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the greatest films of all time
Review_body: I don't know what else I could say about it. Skillfully directed. Maybe Nicholson's best performance. Brad Douriff was incredible. The whole cast is terrific.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is one of the movies that changed the landscape of motion pictures forever.Jack Nicholson appears after his first big role in "Chinatown" and shines. Milos Forman's creation has to be praised- a mixture of drama and comedy fulfilled with deep emotions. Forman presents a whole new world, a world behind "the Wall". There is one enthusiastic person who tries to destroy, or better, avoid this barrier, but finally fails. Like the political scene in the middle 70's in Europe, two different worlds separated, causing so much pain and trouble for a ordinary person. Inside "the Wall" the regime dictates and jeopardizes the basic thoughts of democracy and freedom. Formans great talent to find a balanced story, which enters deeply inside of you; and a remarkable cast of Nicholson, Fletcher, DeVito and Redfield all together make a winning formula.This film was a prototype of all the modern movies made after it, from the "Rain Man", to the "Deer Hunter" to the modern "Girl. Interrupted".Forman and Kubrick led us into a new era of film, as the real leaders of modern Cinema.This is the one of ten or twenty movies you MUST SEE. 9 of 10 easy.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the few movies I consider the best.
Review_body: This movie is extremely realistic. It demonstrated that an honest individual who is funny, who defends himself, who enjoys life, who is always himself is often punished and destroyed by other people... It's only one the strongest impression about this great movie among others I have. This is neither comedy nor tragedy but is a tragicomedy which makes it even more realistic since our life is just that... Another strongest idea: good intentions in fact are horrible, they may lead to deadly consequences like we saw in this masterpiece...
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: From an actors perspective, this is a must-see film. The way Jack and Nurse Ratchett can seamlessly snap between crazy and bizarre is amazing and illusive on screen. The characters aren't static either, we see some normal people amongst a bunch of loony-bins which makes it not so predictable, despite the somewhat obvious name. I think in terms of script, there were some pure gold in terms of lines and words. I found myself taking notes and finding it nearly impossible not to go away laughing about some of the catch- phrases! I think that anyone hoping to act should watch this for this reason. If you are not an actor or performer, make sure you see it anyway. You will be purely entertained, so much so. There are many haunting laughs/looks/scares and it could give you an awful fright!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Firstly, I would like to say, What the hell is wrong with all of you people. The movie sucked, for many reasons. Firstly to any of you who didn't know, this movie was a remake of the book written by Ken Kesey, who refused to work on the screenplay because it would not be told in the same way as the book. If you had read the book you would understand my reasoning. The movie is one of the worst portrayals of a book that I have ever seen. They left so many details out of the movie that were in the book. Two Thumbs down, hopefully this crap will again be remade into something way better than what this is. This should not have been nominated for best picture (1975), and should not have won. The actors who got career boosts from this movie should feel ashamed for working in such a horrible movie and benefiting from it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Watching "One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest" was an experience. It's impossible not to feel sympathetic towards those "crazy" men. At the end, they don't seem crazy at all. That evil nurse is crazy, that one is. Well, I guess we are not supposed to find out if McMurphy was crazy or not, or if his friends were, if there is such a thing as to be crazy. We just sympathize with them enough to see the institution as an enemy. Are they really? Aren't they right after all, trying to control the situation? Well, if they are, I don't want to know. Law can be an awful thing, and that institution was merciless law. This movie is about freedom, about friendship, about going after what you think is right. Madness is only a concept that we use to explain what we don't understand. Life is out there for us to live. There will be consequencesbut there would always be. The final scene is simply unforgettable.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
Assessment:
Why? Does this movie get so much hype? First of all, all the yelling, hootin', and hollering was ridiculous. I had to keep turning it down, it was so loud. Unnecessarily loud. Second of all, what was the storyline, the point? There wasn't one. No cohesiveness. Too random. Third of all, Rached had barely any screen time, and she wasn't over the top mean and all that. Like, at all. I was expecting scenes with her being a tyrant. I don't get it. She didn't do crap to them, except follow and carry out the simple rules. Fourth of all, the acting was pretty good, I'll give it that, but that's all I'll give it. The standards must've been pretty low back then. But, I've always heard throughout my 44 years of existence, how amazing this movie is and whatnot. Meh. At least i can say that I have seen it (take note, it's not, nor ever, I SEEN, don't forget the HAVE) and I can cross it off my list. Definitely giving this one thumbs down.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: In my opinion, this classical masterpiece is the second greatest movie of all time (behind The Godfather). Jack Nicholson gives a tremendous performance in this funny, dramatic, tear-jerking classic. He plays the perfect role and captures it beautifully. By the way, Louise Fletcher was absolutely fabulous also. You just wanted to break her neck during the whole movie. That is a sign of great acting. The final scene is so heart-warming and sad that you can't help but cry and feel good at the same time. There is no doubt in my mind that Jack Nicholson, Louise Fletcher, and Milos Forman (director) all deserved Oscars for this wonderful, dramatic movie!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: IF the criterion to judge the class of a movie is that how you are impressed in the end then it is one of the most frustrating movie I have ever seen. Although direction is very good, actors (All of them) have performed superbly, but the basic thing is storyline which in this movie is totally disappointing specially looking to the rating of this movie. There is no background or object of storyline. Extremely meaningless ending. In fact it is the end of the movie that virtually ruined each and every beautiful aspect of this movie which otherwise could have been a masterpiece. A beautiful Ferrari destroyed in accident with dirty hogs. This movie certainly does not deserve so high rating.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of the best movies ever made. A true masterpiece.
Review_body: "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" has won the Grand Slam of in the Academy Awards of 1975 (Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Screenplay) against stiff opposition and this is not for nothing. This movie, directed by Milos Forman, is a true masterpiece of human emotion and its themes of individual liberty creativity are universal and far-stretching. Although this movie is about a mental hospital, its themes are applicable to everything in our daily lives. R.P. McMurphy, superbly portrayed by Jack Nicholson (definitely his best role) who "fights and *ucks too much" is classified as mentally instable and sent to a mental asylum, exactly in the ward of Ms Ratched. Ratched is a control-freak and very old-fashioned, but she truly believes that she is helping her patients to get better. She is not Evil with a capital "E" and this one of the themes of the movie: How human beings can do harm to others without even knowing, actually thinking they're doing the right thing. McMurphy, fond of his personal freedom and creativity instills a sense of liberty and rebellion into his fellow ward companions, whose character is entirely imprisoned by the Ratched's engulfing persona. He gives them a confidence boost in their own abilities and tells them (in most cases rightly so) that they're not "crazier than the average man in the street". We get to know that the patients are staying willingly at the hospital and if they want they can quit. McMurphy is shocked when learning this, and so is the audience viewing the film. We ask ourselves - "why are they staying here, caged?". McMurphy tries to make his new friends liberate themselves and pursue a new active life. He is willing to risk his own freedom in order to achieve this goal - and in the end, he pays hard for it, although his aim is achieved. At the end of the movie, we have mixed feelings and strong emotions - we can both cry and cheer.The acting and direction are top-notch, and the music at the end gives the ending an edge you'll find hard to forget. "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" was based on a book of the same name, written by Ken Kesey. Find it and read it. And for God's sake, buy this movie, see it and cherish it for all your life.10/10 - I just wish more movies like "One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest" were made.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Fantastic film - heavy but moments of great humour
Review_body: I watched this movie last night for the first time. Today I just can't get this movie out of my head! It was completely brilliant - superbly acted, fantastic script, and priceless humor mixed with some real hard and tormenting messages about the treatment inside the mental health institute.Jack Nicholson was riveting to watch. He played the pragmatist, Mr McMurphy. Ultimately he was incredibly genuine, broke all the boundaries, and brought out his comical humour to slice through the most troubling and tense of moments. Mrs Ratched - I didn't know what to think of her at first... it took me a while to work out what her intentions were. I thought it was brilliant how the director, Milos Forman, gradually revealed this antagonist's true colours, because on first impressions you believe she is just doing a difficult job. Well at least I didn't realise what a sour sweet she was!But the one word I came away feeling to describe her - suffocating. Watching this movie you feel trapped, dominated and oppressed by her unreadable expression, her persistent interrogating techniques used in "therapy", and her need for total control. You get a very uncomfortable feeling of powerlessness to her robotic, squashing and crushing demeanor. Very hard to watch in some places. Her group "therapy" with the stuttering Billy being one which sticks out in my mind. Enough to make you need therapy! Was she pure evil, incredibly ill-informed, or a dictator on a power trip? Must say my favorite scene was the basketball match with the "deaf and dumb" Indian giant, Chief, running up and down the court, completely annihilating the opponents as he put into practice the 'arms up' movement that Jack Nicholson had taught him early. A great cinematic moment! 10 out of 10.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Nicholson shines in "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest"
Review_body: While watching Milos Foreman's "One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest", it occurred to me that I've been on a real psych movie kick lately. Shutter Island, Good Will Hunting, Cuckoo's Nest...I even caught myself looking at YouTube videos of Titicut Follies the other day. Psychiatry is often portrayed in a negative light in the media-- as a field of medicine where pedophiles and monsters pump their patients full of pills and electroshock while caging them like animals. While the field has come a long way in the last hundred years, the early 20th century was marred with highly dangerous and pseudo scientific procedures and patterns of inhumane treatment toward patients. "One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest" is, among other things, a commentary on the barbarism of mid-century psychiatry.An adaptation of the classic anti-establishment novel by Ken Kesey, "One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest" follows the free-spirited criminal Randall McMurphy (Jack Nicholson) as he is being admitted to an Oregan mental hospital. Randall aims to be declared insane so that he may ride out his short prison term in what he feels will be a comparatively comfortable setting. McMurphy is put in a ward with quite an eclectic cast of characters including the 6'5" Native American "Chief" Bromden (Will Sampson), stuttering suicidal Billy Bibbit (Brad Douriff, who would later go on to play Wormtongue in the Lord of the Rings movies), the diminutive Mr. Martini (Danny DeVito, a connection I didn't notice until well over halfway through the movie!) and the spastic "Taber" (Christopher Lloyd). Shortly after his admission to the hospital, McMurphy begins to notice that many of the patients are being abused and degraded, kept in submission by the tyrannical and calculating Head Nurse Ratched (Louise Fletcher). McMurphy bands together with the other patients in his ward to mount a rebellion against the oppressive Ratched, causing more than a few riotous moments.This film is intellectual gold. Aside from being immensely culturally relevant (a strong theme of individuality v. authority/establishment is felt throughout) the film is a scathing commentary on the state of mental health treatment in the 1960's (Ken Kesey based the story on his experience working in a VA Hospital in Palo Alto, California). The means and methods of treatment were inelegant and at times did more harm than good, while patients were stripped of their individuality and reduced to helpless subhuman husks of men in hospital Johnny coats. The dialog is smart, the direction is spot on (a number of the extras were actual mental patients, and the actors supposedly stayed in character between takes). The film lacks any true emotional content, save for the final scene, but overall I found it to be thoroughly satisfying.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This movie is awesome, Jack Nicholson is amazing and fully deserves the awards he got from this film, i cant imagine anyone who could have played the part better - the role of McMurphy was originally offered to James Caan (Godfather,Misery). other star performers in this movie are: William Redfield (who died a a few months after the film was released), Louise Fletcher, Danny Divito, William Duell, Josip Elic, Christopher Lloyd and Brad Dourif. This movie has everything a good story, good acting, comedy, sad parts and a great ending. one flew over the cuckoos nest is totally different to any other film i've seen before which is amazing because it came out in 1975, I'm surprised no one has made anything like this because it was such a big movie when it first came out( won 5 Oscars. Another 26 wins & 11 nominations ) This and monty pythons holy grail are the best movies of 1975 and is up there with the Godfather as one of the movies of the 70's.Interesting trivia on this film: Many extras were authentic mental patients. I would give this film a 10/10 Main good points: brilliant acting - most of the actors performances of their career, great story and the bus scene(one of the funniest ever) Main bad points: none
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Jack Nicholson's mere presence in this picture was enough to bring this production to the screen, after the novel written by Ken Kesey was dubbed as 'unfilmable'; once Nicholson had his name on the contract, Hollywood took over. Nicholson's performance granted him an Oscar with acknowledgements that he was born to play the role of a misfit gone crazy when admitted into an insane asylum. The picture was moving yet simple and funny and was labelled as a dramatic masterpiece as it highlighted society's distorted outlook on the 'mentally unstable' and eventually won the 'top five' Oscars and was the second film in history to do so. This could never have been achieved if Nicholson's reputation had not got the ball rolling on this project in the first place. This picture was rightly the definition of the character that Nicholson should play and made him the top choice to play Jack Torrance in The Shining and the Joker in the 1989 interpretation of Batman.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: As Jiddu Krishnamurti said; "It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society. In my humble opinion 'One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest' is an analogy of a brilliant, uncontrollable, free mind trapped in a sick society where being different is the deadliest sin. The society (insane asylum) orders you to conform and if you resist to conform you will be eliminated one way or another.. Although R.P. McMurphy (Jack Nicholson) cant win, at least he tries. "But I tried, didn't I? Goddamnit, at least I did that."This is an extraordinarily brilliant and impressive film for all beautiful free minds.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I loved this film, the acting is superb by all, it has its fun moments, it's sad moments and is just one of the best films I have ever seen, jack nicholson is absolutely brilliant in this, going from sane person to complete madman in a split second, also glad to see danny devito in this even though it is not a staring role for himJust the way all the characters connect to take on the nurse had me laughing all the way through, also there are some excellent dramatic sad moments that will leave you crying and frustrated at the same time, this may just well be the best film ever madeI would highly recommend it to anyone 10/10
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: "Jack Nicholson at his best a truly wonderful film."
Review_body: Quite simply one of the greatest films ever made. Flawless film making from start to finish.Powerful emotional funny sad this film has it All. Milos forman directs this film beautifully capturing all the emotions and sadness along the way.The acting is outstanding.Jack Nicholson finally win's his Oscar after four nominations. A brilliant supporting cast including Christopher Lloyd Danny Devito and Brad Dourif. If you have not watched this great film I truly recommend it. Every actor is at the top of there game , if you are fans of them you will really enjoy this Cinematic master piece. 10/10
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Ah so touching I didn't want him to die though good end and its so warm to see how he was treating them and when had the chance to leave he stayed with them known that they are crazy oh jack u surprise me every time I watch your movie Definitely one of the greats love love love love
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is by far one of my favorite movies. I think everyone should watch it. I hope that people don't expect anything outside. It mainly takes place indoor. you will understand as soon as you check it out. So many actors to check out. Its just a classic that you have to watch at least once in your life. I remember i read the book when i was in high school and then we had to watch the movie in class. I also remember we had to act out a scene and film it. i acted as one of the loonies. Any who you should definitely watch this and enjoy because it is just one of those flicks that you should just have seen. You get to see a lot of actors who were just starting their careers
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I used to visit mental hospital. I was wondering sometimes, if there are really people, who shouldn't be there like McMurphy.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: The movie shook me to the core.I experienced all kinds of emotions at the maximum possible level while watching it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Beautiful film filled with such amazing performances, unforgettable moments and great characters. The film is very touching and I recommend it to everyone who appreciates an excellent cinematic production.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Jack rocks this movie! What an awesome piece of film this is. So very powerful and raw with emotion. This movie has a little something for everyone. And a little something to rock most peoples boat! Characters are insanely real! So subtle in ways and so bold and in your face in others. My favorite Nicholson role. Just remember, before the Joker there was Randle!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: A smile with a great lesson.
Review_body:
One those rare movies which make smile from start to end.
It describe perfectly how one's life can be changed in a second by others error.Wonderful movie and make it to the top ten movies ever watched by me.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is simply the best film ever made. If you disagree, watch it again and again until you don't.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This film is a pioneer of films to do with mental health disorders. I get so nostalgic when I see this film and remember back to the good old days when films were made right. Jack Nicholson knows how it's done. I gave it a 9 in the hopes a modern film will top it and get a 10!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: To watch at least once in your life
Review_body: This is the representation of life made by a movie. A story that is able to touch specific feelings in everyone's personal experience of life. One of my favourite actin performance ever made by Jack Nicholson.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: This is a ''rare'' Class A movie that surely deserves 10/10.It's a film that will influence anybody deeply till the rest of their life. Every scene is so alive and so natural and you get carried away by the acting. You almost feel like you are one of the characters, or you want to be one of them at least...because they're having so much fun in their roles and they're putting so much enthusiasm at every moment. It's not like they are acting, they literally are living in that mental institution!! Jack Nicholson's best movie in my opinion and he shines throughout the movie. He plays the role with his flesh and mind and soul(with everything he got), he made every effort to help this movie stay a masterpiece forever. In other words, every time you watch the movie, it gets better and better, you start to appreciate the details of the film more...It's not like Fight Club or Memento, (or any other flashy good movies of 1990s and 2000s). Young generations should avoid judging the movie by comparing to movies of today. This is one of the best movies ever made.(Of course not better than Godfather Series or Kubrick's movies between 60s' and 80's) Everybody MUST SEE it at least once in their lifetime. I have already seen it 4 times. I absolutely fell in love with it.(The only other film influenced me this much is of course Godfather).I've watched it over and over again 3 times in the same day. Don't forget to watch the making of the movie too! It's a brilliant movie, in its magical psychological atmosphere, you can find life itself with its ups and downs.So be prepared to laugh at one moment and cry the next.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Review_body: Milos Forman's "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" film describes a nature of rudimentary society.The mental hospital symbolizes the society.In this film we can see how they treat mentally ill people.They always try to protect them and treat them as patients and they never try to think out of regulations.Surprisingly McMurphy come to this hospital.McMurphy has no insights into the nature of mental illness, which is his blessing. He's an extroverted man and he always sees his fellow patients as his teammates.From that spirit he makes them very happy and he is the life force to them.He teaches how to think out of the frame.It is the best way to cure mentally unstable people but the hospital crew do not understand that reality.So hospital gives him a lobotomy, which put him into a vegetative state, rendering him silent and motionless.That is the true nature of rudimentary society.If there is a man who thinks differently ,society do not trust him.They all blame him and they force him to believe in conventional society believes.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I read the book One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest in my Messages in Film class at school. I adored it. What an amazing story! The characters were captivating and well developed. It is one of the best books I had ever read. Then, my teacher says we are going to watch the movie. She told us about how great it was and all the Academy Awards it had won, and I was excited. I didn't really expect it to be able to live up to the book, but I knew it would still be a good film. I even got on this website, and low and behold, it is the number 12 movie of ALL TIME! I was surprised and now my expectations were a little higher. Then I watched the movie. I was shocked at how horrible of an adaptation it was. Not only that, but even if you completely forgot about the book, it was not even a good film! Where was the Christ imagery? McMurphy is the embodiment (other than his love of women) of Jesus Christ in the book. He lays down his life for the good of the other men. By the time McMurphy is wheeled back into the ward after the lobotomy in the book, all the men are gone except Chief and two others. Why? Because he gave the men strength enough to realize they did not need this place! He sacrificed himself FOR A REASON! In the movie, all the men are still in the ward! What was the reason for his sacrifice then? Also, why are the men so hateful towards each other in the movie? In the book, they band together as brothers. Again, in the movie the Chief takes a back seat. He does not even come along for the boat ride. Without delving into the Chief, you miss the whole point of the book: The Combine. The book was about the sacrifice of one man to rid one small part of the world of evil and totalitarianism. They don't even scratch the surface of an evil reign in the movie. In a word, this movie was abysmal. Not even Jack Nichlosan's (SP) performance can save it.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: One of the best of all time. I prefer comedy's but this was still a quality entertainment film none the less.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: I have a great deal of favorite films, but if I must choose one absolute favorite, it would have to be this one. Jack Nicholson is one of the most superbly talented actors of all-time. I enjoy watching so many of his films. (Keep up the FABULOUS work Jack!) I don't quite know what else to say except "wow". The story is excellent, the acting extraordinary. (I promise myself -as I do everytime- that I will not cry the next time I watch it)---that's a big "yea right"
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: You don't have to blow things up or sink a ship to make a good movie.
Review_body: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is a film that speaks to what is best about cinema.  It is an engaging story that makes its point without handing it to the viewer on a silver platter.  It puts you in a place that you normally wouldn't have access to and exposes you to numerous individuals that make us feel like better people for having known them.  Jack Nicholson's performance is superb as is the young Danny DeVito's.  The move toward independent film is most likely a direct result of films like this whose depth of emotion keeps the viewer glued to their seat until the credits role (and maybe even a little longer.)
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: The story of a man who is sent to a mental hospital
Review_body: It's a pity we don't see such movies more often.... It's a great film with great performances. Jack Nicholson here gives maybe his best performance ever. And even though the film and script were shot/written about 30 years ago it is still so current. I'm sure same or even worse conditions can be found in some of today's mental institutions.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Wow!  I can't believe it's taken me this long to see this movie!  I really enjoyed it:  Jack Nicholson is superb (his many facial nuances really grab me), Christopher Lloyd is amazing, Will Sampson is great, and Danny DeVito is stellar (I'm sorry, but for half the movie, I wouldn't even believe this was Danny because he did such a fascinating job!).This movie gets you right in the heart.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One of my all-time favorites -- love Jack Nicholson character!
Review_body: Was introduced to this movie by a Literature Teacher at a Community College. The movie was great!  The book was even better!!  The movie makes a few changes in the original story, mostly in the point of view from which it is told.  The "Chief" narrates the book, but the movie concentrates more on the Nicholson character -- Randal.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: People may say that Citizen Kane is number one or Casablanca or even newer films or animated ones. But Milos Foreman's One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest is the best film EVER made. It is a tragic and hilarious. Touching and moving. It is both drama and comedy and balances it well.Nicholson gives the performance of his career he deserved his award as did Fletcher. True this was Nicholson's film but he certainly was not my favorite character. That title belongs to the character of good ol' Charlie Cheswick. He was warm and moving and equally naive. Cheswick stole just about all of the scenes he was in.This film usually has to suffer the debate of whether this or Jaws was better. Yes Jaws changed the summer blockbuster, was Steven Spielberg's masterpiece and is remembered more but the Academy Awards was 100% right in choosing this as the best picture of 1975. It is by far a superior picture. Not to say Jaws is bad but this film is the king of the motion picture industry.The bottom line is this is my favorite film and will always be because of it's authenticity ( real mental institution patients were used) and it's tragicly funny story. In my opinion it is the definitive masterpiece, classic and number 1.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: One thing I would like to say is that this a great movie all around and by reading most of the comments youll see Im not alone in saying that. The main reason for this comment is a response to a couple of the other comments. Other people said " I didnt think nurse Ratchett was that bad, she's was just doing her job." What a bunch of crap. Watch the movie and find out that Nicholson should have been the nurse there. He's the only one there providing any help toward the other patients. If you notice the nurse sees the positive response to Nicholson by the the other patients that she is very jealous! Ratchett insists everytime to keep Nicholson in the asylum longer when the rest of the Board is completely convinced he is normal. Even Nicholson proves most of the patients in the asylum aren't even close to being insane. It's just the sedating drugs and shock treatments that mess them up. And nurse Ratchett gets off on all of it. I swear if you watch this movie and don't want to beat the nurse in the head there's something wrong with you! She played that part awesome! Just a little response to the other comments. I think most of you will agree with me. Enjoy.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: For me, the 1970's really was the greatest ever period for films: The Godfather 1 & 2, Taxi Driver, Jaws, Star Wars, Halloween, Dog Day Afternoon, Mean Streets, etc. I could go on forever. But this one still stands out. Has anyone ever given a more involving, believable, bloody perfect performance than Jack does as Randall P. McMurphy? The whole cast are great, of course. What ever happened to Brad Dourif (apart from Bride of Chucky)? It's the greatest mix of pure sadness and riotous comedy ever. If you're a human being, you can't fail to respond to this masterpiece. The perfect ending: tragedy tinged with a glimmer of hope. The best films these days, like Seven, just seem better to us because there is no competition. Back in the Seventies, they probably would have suffered
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: an encouraging movie for people under oppressing
Review_body: it's a story about liberty and very encouraging till now, though filmed 25 years ago. People who don't believe in super power and confused by the routine life should take a look at this one, but maybe not everyone of them could catch the sense the producer wanted to deliver. free at last.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
After reading the book, I decided to rent the movie, just to see how well it was translated for the big screen. In fact, it totally screws around with the plot. People die in the middle of the book(Cheswick drowns), and at the end of this movie, he's still alive! That was a big part of the novel! McMurphy doesn't steal the bus to go fishing, in fact, it was suggested as a field trip, to which Nurse Ratched agreed to if he brought enough men.This movie is one of the worst adaptations from a book I have ever watched. This movie does not deserve all of the praise it gets. If anything, Jaws or Dog Day Afternoon should have taken home Best Picture of that year.
1/10.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: an energetic con man convict is sent to a mental hospital where he changes the lives of everyone there forever.
Review_body: Not a single fan of film can declare One Flew Over the Cukoo's Nest as anything less than spectacular.  It has all the key elements of a great film.  From story to photography.  From character to performance.  It has a life of it's own.  I have found over the years that there are moviegoers and there are film lovers.  This is a film lover's film.  A film for those who find crying as important as laughing, and thinking important to us all.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: Great Movie of a Great novel. Worth your time. Many future stars in this one.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: It's a true masterpiece. Like something that was wrenched from the surreal dreams, images in this movie are dark, funny, disturbing, thought-provoking, and profound, all at the same time. This is truly a movie you can watch multiple times and find new themes each time. When it was released, it had some important things to say. Today, in our society that is scared into semi-paralysis by the threat of terrorists and the overly oppressive response of our own government, this movie is more relevant than ever. If you pay attention, you may actually walk away from this movie with a profound sense of understanding. Most everyone I have recommended this movie to has been deeply moved in some way by it. This movie should be required viewing!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: Strong message, but just like those boring high school poems
Review_body: The acting was spot on. But, it's just that I was expecting something a lot more in a movie which has been rated this high. Yes, I get it, there is a tremendous moral and a message, but the story just makes you super sad. And it is really boring at times
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: It makes me so sad that movies cannot be the same as books. I understand that it's an entirely different medium and all, but still. I was unfortunate enough to have watched the movie after reading the book. Unfortunate in that because of this the movie was disappointing for me. The book is so complex and emotionally moving, as well as mentally stimulating, that although the movie was good, it didn't even come close to being as memorable. If anyone asked me which was more worthwhile I would unflinchingly answer 'the book'. And if they did decide to do a remake of the film, I reckon Tom Waits would be way better casting for McMurphy than Nicholson.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body:
One of the greatest movies of all time!
Jack plays his character perfectly. Some of the best actors and acting ever!!
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest Review
Review_body: One Flew over the Cuckoo's Nest by Milos Forman really did amaze me with the Actors, Cinematography, and Soundtrack. I usually am not a huge fan of older movies and I was super wowed about how the music intertwined with characters and the overall look of the movie. In the movie there wasn't that many songs present and I honestly didn't even notice the music in the beginning, after the movie I did realize where the music was placed. The overall look of the movie was great, the actors portrayed the soulful aspects as they should for this difficult movie. Overall, I was quite surprised with this movie and would like to watch it again to rediscover this information all over again.
Movie_name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Review_body: In "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest," by Milos Forman, followed the book, but not in the way of Chief's perspective and the music was powerless compared to the rest of the movie; however, the movie had talented actors. In the book, it was very detailed and more menaful to read rather than watching the movie that left out or didn't convey the details that were very known in the book. The movie is in a different perspective rather than the book and I don't feel the movie was as effective than the book. The music, was very drab and didn't get me into the scene that it was playing in because it didn't fit the scene it was playing in. In the beginning, the music that played was very displeasing to listen to. One the rather hand, the actors, especially McMurphy who was played by Jack Nicholson, really portrayed their characters of the movie.
